title: Senior Community Developer
description:
**The Position**  

As the Senior Community Developer for Contraband, our upcoming AAA co-op open world action game and new IP published by Microsoft Xbox Game Studios, your role is to identify, grow and engage a diverse, inclusive and passionate community around the game.  

You will set up and manage the feedback loop between the Development team and our Community (Player council, Insiders, testers), to provide actionable insights to the team.  

When the Community team for Contraband expands, they will report into this role, adding a people management responsibility to mentor and coach the more junior team members.  

**What you'll do**  

* Define, plan, and deliver the Community Development strategy in close collaboration with Product, Marketing, Creative, and Development teams.
* Collaborate with our publisher’s community team at Microsoft Xbox, to deliver on their best practices.
* Build and grow tester and early adopter communities that are fun, inclusive, and representative of our player segments.
* Design and manage the Community feedback loops, rolling out a framework for effective communication flow.
* Serve as a community insight leader, contributing expertise to help create the best game for our targeted players.
* Regularly report on community engagement and health, deriving insights to improve our strategies and plans continually.
* Actively engage on our community platforms to provide context for sentiment reporting.
* Plan and execute community activities and content calendars.
* Write community and social copy, and asset requirement brief for the marketing creative team.

  

**Who you are**  

* A practical and seasoned community strategy specialist with a minimum of 5 years of experience and participation in at least one major game launch.
* Adept at developing gaming communities from the ground up and comfortable with managing communities on various platforms, such as Discord and Steam Forums.
* Proficient in using common social media tools, sentiment reporting, and analytics, with an understanding of current and future market trends.
* An enthusiastic gamer who understands the community and enjoys the thrill of a AAA explosive action experience game.
* A firm believer in collaboration and transparency, able to balance the feedback and needs of various stakeholders.
* Able to juggle internal and external communications effectively, with proven experience working with multilevel stakeholders in multinational matrixed organizations.
* Previous experience at an international games publisher or developer is required.
*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.* **The Stockholm location**
Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp. **Our values**
At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity. **How to apply**
To apply for this position, provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement. *At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please not that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*
company_description: Avalanche Studios is the original creator of the award-winning Just Cause franchise (published by Square Enix) with the third entry release

title: Partyking söker en magnifik Systemutvecklare
description:
*På Partyking har vi antagit uppdraget Fight Boredom. Det betyder att vi alla tillsammans ska bekämpa vardagstristessen och göra våra egna och våra kunders liv lite roligare varje dag. Det är ett otroligt viktigt uppdrag som vi tar på stort allvar och med stor humor.*

*Vi finns för att göra det lätt att ha roligt. Vi ska göra allt vi kan för att bekämpa tristess.*

 **Uppdragsbeskrivning:**


Vi växer så det knakar och vårat IT-team behöver fler utvecklare! Vi jobbar med en e-handelslösning byggd i främst **Javascript** och **PHP** som driftas på Amazon Web Services (**AWS**).


Uppdraget består i att utveckla vår webbshop, samt vidareutveckla och supporta ett gäng andra interna stödsystem. Du är en del av ett snabbfotat team som samarbetar nära övriga avdelningar som exempelvis lager och kundservice för att planera, designa och implementera ny funktionalitet i alla delar av systemet.


Som Systemutvecklare i Partykings IT-team bedriver man sitt arbete på plats i Gävle, men med goda möjligheter till distansarbete.

 **Vem är det vi söker?**


Vi letar efter en nyfiken och engagerad **fullstackutvecklare** som vill vara med på vår resa! Antingen har du några års erfarenhet i ryggen eller så är du nyexaminerad och har en stark drivkraft att utvecklas och växa i rollen!


Vi ser gärna att du:


Har erfarenhet av **JavaScript och PHP** (eller en vilja att snabbt lära dig)  

Är en **lösningsorienterad lagspelare** med en nyfiken inställning  

Vågar testa **nya tekniker** och strävar efter att lämna koden i bättre skick än du fann den  

Trivs i en **snabbrörlig e-handelsmiljö** där ditt arbete gör skillnad varje dag


Vi ser det som **meriterande** om du har en vilja att ta ett större ansvar inom teamet och kan tänka dig att axla en ledande roll vid behov, i nära samarbete med IT-chefen.




**Om Partyking**


Kampen för att skapa mer fest i vardagen startades 2009 när Partykungen.se lanserades i Sverige. Idag sprider vi glädje och bekämpar tristessen även i våra grannländer Norge, Danmark och Finland under namnet Partyking. Man säger att ett gott skratt förlänger livet och vi vill att våra kunder ska leva längst av alla. Vi säljer allt till festen och en roligare vardag via e-handel. Vi är stolta över vårt viktiga uppdrag; FIGHT BOREDOM.


Partykings huvudkontor och lager är beläget i Gävle, där fler än 45 000 produkter ryms i vårt 8300 m² stora lager. Här finns möjligheter att växa i takt med företagets utveckling och din prestation påverkar företagets framgång på kort och lång sikt. Arbetet är varierande och den ena dagen är inte den andra lik. Vi kan erbjuda en trivsam arbetsmiljö, fantastiska arbetskamrater och en organisation som är snabb, effektiv och handlingskraftig.  

  

**Ansök nu!**

  

Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, vi ser fram emot din ansökan!  

Vid frågor om annonsen eller tjänsten: martin@partyking.com

title: Fullstack Developer within eHealth
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1100 employees in several countries.*  

  

*Since 2012, MittVaccin has been a pioneer in digital service development for residents and healthcare providers within both the private and public healthcare sectors. Since 2020, we are Cambio MittVaccin, and as a member of Cambio, our innovation and digitalization of vaccination services have accelerated. With the trust of 13 regions and 350 healthcare providers with clinics in over 220 municipalities in Sweden's all 21 regions, we have a nationwide presence, continuously striving to improve the interaction between vaccinators and residents. MittVaccin is the singlest largest source of vaccination information in Sweden supporting not only its many healthcare providers but also national reporting and information sharing. Our work increases awareness, knowledge, and accessibility to vaccinations. In this way, we aim to drive demand for patient-safe and efficient vaccination management in Sweden, ultimately benefiting both public health and society’s protection against serious diseases**.*

 **The position**  

As a Fullstack Developer with us, you will have the opportunity to work on and develop Sweden's most modern and well-established digital vaccination platform – MittVaccin; both the EHR system and the Inhabitant service mittvaccin.se and related solution components. You will be part of a dynamic and agile organization with global ambitions. Every team member is an essential link in the chain, and each person has significant individual responsibility and the opportunity to shape their role. You will see firsthand how your development work contributes to public benefit and preventive healthcare for all.


In this role, you will work on the development, design, and architecture of both our frontend and backend, with a primary focus on backend. You will also be involved in technical investigations as part of your work. Together with the development team—comprising system developers, solution architects, product owners, and others—you will drive the development of MittVaccin Journal and MittVaccin Citizen Service forward.


The focus is on new development and building from scratch rather than pure maintenance. Key requirements for the services include scalability, performance, regulatory compliance, medical safety, and self-service functionality. The development team works agilely using Kanban and Scrum in sprints, with multiple service releases each year. You will participate in sprint planning alongside product owners and the rest of the development team.

  

Our workplace is characterized by modern and coaching leadership, respect, inclusion, transparency, personal ownership, flexibility, continuous improvement, and a strong commitment to caring for each other as colleagues and human beings.


At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.

 **About you**  

You are passionate about finding the best solutions for our customers, have a pedagogical approach, and find it interesting to deepen your understanding of various healthcare processes and needs—translating them into technical solutions. You work independently with strong self-motivation but also thrive when collaborating with your team members or customers.


**Requirements**


* 5+ years of experience as a full-stack developer
* Strong proficiency in SQL (including stored programs, views, and performance optimization)
* Extensive knowledge of PHP and PHPUnit, including object-oriented frameworks
* Experience with JavaScript and React or similar libraries
* Knowledge of API design and development
* Experience in requirements gathering, architecture/design, and development infrastructure
* Solid experience working with agile methodologies, such as Scrum and Kanban
* Experience working with IT/development in swedish healthcare, providing an understanding of relevant laws and regulations affecting system design
* Ability to communicate fluently in Swedish, as it is required for daily communication.


**It's a bonus if you have**

* Experience with some of the following: MySQL, Apache, Redis, Docker or Git
* Experience with clustered environments and load balancing for web applications
* Experience with API technologies such as SOAP and REST
* Experience using standards and reference models for healthcare informatics and interoperability, such as FHIR, OpenEHR, Snomed-CT, ICD, KVÅ, and related regulatory frameworks for information management
* Experience working with IT/development in healthcare, giving you an understanding of the laws and regulations that impact system design

 **Place of employment**: Stockholm


At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.

**Scope**: Full time

**Form of employment:** Permanent employment, 6 months trial period


**Other:** We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.


We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in **Sweden.** We will ask for verification during the process.


**We look forward to receiving your application!**


Read more about us **here!**


Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site **here!**

title: Backendutvecklare och AWS-specialist
description:
Vi söker en senior utvecklare/ arkitekt med bred erfarenhet av AWS och mjukvarulösningar med förmågan att se helheten. Du förväntas även ha lång erfarenhet som utvecklare och en öppenhet för att skriva, granska och felsöka kod i rollen som AWS-specialist.


Som AWS-specialist på Devoteam kommer du vara ledande i att ta fram den för kunden mest lämpade lösningen. Du behöver ha förmågan att diskutera, förklara samt motivera dina arkitekturella val. Vi ser dig också som aktiv i vårt partnersamarbete där du gärna tidigt utforskar nya erbjudanden inom din plattform, och leder utvecklingen för molninnovation inom Creative Tech. Certifieringar inom AWS är viktigt och meriterande men inte ett krav.


**Vad förväntar vi oss av dig?**

* Har minst 6 års erfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling.
* Arbetat ett par år i en liknande roll och vet vilka verktyg och metoder som är lämpliga.
* Har erfarenhet av att orientera dig i komplexa miljöer och organisationer.
* Trivs med att omsätta verksamhetskrav till design av säkra, skalbara samt kostnadseffektiva lösningar.
* Har erfarenhet av att designa och bygga API:er.
* Har erfarenhet att jobba med säkerhet, tex genom hotmodellering.
* Kan föra kunddiskussioner både på svenska och engelska.
* Stark vilja att leverera utmärkt service, med fokus på kundens behov och framgång.
* Har en genuin förståelse för det agila tillvägagångssättet och en vilja och ett fokus att snabbt kunna leverera värde.
* God förståelse för DevOps-principer och förmåga att integrera dem i arkitekturella beslut.

**Arbetsplats**  

Arbetsplatsen för den här rollen är Malmö med omnejd.


**Om Devoteam**  

Hos oss värderar vi medarbetarnas trivsel och utveckling högt. Vi har byggt en arbetskultur där människor känner sig inspirerade, utmanade och trygga. Vi tror att när du trivs och växer, så gör även våra lösningar det.


Vi är ett ledande IT-konsultföretag med en stark förankring i Malmös tech-community, både som Devoteam och f.d .Jayway. Vi är engagerade i att skapa långsiktiga relationer med både kunder och medarbetare. Vi drivs av en passion för teknik och innovation, och erbjuder skräddarsydda lösningar för företag inom en rad olika branscher. Bland våra initiativ kan nämnas Øredev , en av Skandinaviens största utvecklarkonferenser, som vi var med och grundade.


**Förmåner och praktisk information:**

* Kontinuerligt lärande: Vi stöder kontinuerligt lärande med kompetensgrupper varannan vecka, deltagande på Øredev och löpande kompetensdagar för din professionella utveckling. Du har möjlighet att ta certifikat med någon av våra partners (AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Ledighet och pension: Vi erbjuder 30 dagars semester, kompletterande föräldraledighetsersättning och tjänstepension enligt ITP1.
* Hälsa och välbefinnande: Självklara förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag, tillgång till företagshälsovård, hälsokontroller och lunchyoga på kontoret.
* Verktyg och utrustning: Du väljer själv de verktyg du behöver för att leverera och trivas i din arbetsmiljö.

**Ansökan**  

För att ansöka, vänligen skicka din ansökan via länken nedan. Vi uppmuntrar tidiga ansökningar eftersom vi granskar dem löpande.


För eventuella frågor, kontakta Sanna Ekelöf, vår rekryterare, på sanna.ekelof@devoteam.com. Sanna kommer att vara din primära kontaktperson under hela rekryteringsprocessen.
company_description: Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* At least 5 years of experience in development with React/TypeScript
* Experience working with the latest versions of Next.js
* At least 3 years of documented experience working with web accessibility. Understands the WCAG standard.
* At least 3 years of experience in agile product development within a team
* Proficient in communicating in Swedish, both spoken and written.


**Meritorious**
* Contributed to optimizing code to improve SEO.
* Strong drive to share expertise with the rest of the team.
* Experience working with design systems.
* Open to learning new technologies and has a general curiosity and exploratory mindset in technical matters.
* Experience in setting up Continuous Deployment (CD) in cloud environments, preferably with ArgoCD.


**Application deadline:** 
 20-03-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Software Engineer (.NET Core)
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are a forward-thinking team creating cutting-edge, cloud-based communication solutions. Our backend systems leverage the latest C# and .NET Core technologies, deployed in Kubernetes on AWS. We thrive on collaboration, innovation, and crafting scalable, reliable systems that power seamless communication worldwide.
   

  

 If you're a Senior Backend Engineer with a passion for problem-solving, clean code, and modern DevOps practices, we'd love to have you on our team.
   

  

**Role**
 As a Senior Backend Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing backend systems while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop scalable and resilient distributed systems using C# and .NET Core.
* Work closely with engineers, DevOps specialists, and product managers in an agile, cross-functional team.
* Build and maintain applications running on Kubernetes, actively monitor production systems, and ensure reliability.
* Leverage AWS tools and services to deploy, optimize, and scale cloud-based systems.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Major professional experience building and maintaining backend systems in production.
* Expertise in C#, .NET Core, and developing distributed systems.
* Solid understanding of DevOps principles and experience with CI/CD pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Service-oriented architecture and microservices.
* Relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, MSSQL, Redis).
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes and AWS.
* Incident response and on-call rotations.
* Proficiency in additional programming languages such as C++, Python, or Kotlin
* Experience with Asterisk and VoIP protocols, preferably SIP.


 Embrace the challenge and join us! You will have the chance to:
   

  

* Work with a talented and diverse team in a culture that values innovation and collaboration.
* Take on meaningful challenges and grow with the latest technologies.
* Enjoy flexibility with hybrid work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Benefit from competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare insurance, pension contributions, and wellness allowance.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Company Description** 




 Zaver is a fast-growing fintech based in Stockholm. At Zaver, we develop innovative payment solutions to accelerate the revolution of size-agnostic frictionless payments in the underserved markets. The vision is bold, and in the long run we aim to build an ecosystem of AI-powered financial products.
 



  





 We’re passionate about new technologies and customer experiences. We work hard to challenge the legacy giants in our industry and now we’re starting to see the result of all the hard work. We launched Zaver for Business in 2019 and since then we have gone from 0 to billions of EUR in transaction volume. Today, lighthouse brands such as Porsche, Loewe, Doktor.se and Sweef have put their trust in our solutions.
 



  





 We are backed by some of the most prominent investors in the region, most of which are either founders of unicorns themselves, or backers of unicorns.
 



  





 Right now, the mothership is taking off and we’re therefore looking for customer-obsessed all-star players to join our team. 
 



  





**Job Description** 




 Whether you have several years of experience or if you are relatively new to the industry does not matter much to us; we are looking for the right person for the role and will adapt the position accordingly. No job is too big or too small. 
 



  





 You’ll play an essential role in developing the Zaver payments platform with next-generation products and features. Your work on the code base will in the matter of hours be live and affect the whole customer base. You’ll need to be able to work with everything from credit risk assessment and our in-house developed banking back office platform, to customer-facing front-ends with instant effect - and everything in between. 
 



  





 Needless to say, you possess the skills required to be part of an efficient tech team revolutionizing the durables segment in a fast-paced environment.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Engineering 🤷🏼‍♀️
* Work across our entire tech stack: backend, mobile apps and web.
* Become friends with Amazon Web Services.
* Take part in different stages of the product life cycle: design, implementation, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
* Collaborate with designers and other professionals on large- and small-scale projects.



  
 



 You will work in close collaboration with amazing people, use new technology and breaking new ground in the payments space by shipping products far better than anything else in the market. 
 



  





**Bonus Skills** 



* DevOps
* Flutter
* Java
* K8S



  
 



**Additional Information** 




 At Zaver we believe in people, teamwork and an entrepreneurial spirit. Working with us you will make a real impact, both within the company and the industry. And with the right mindset and ambition, you will find room to grow and thrive. 
 



  
 



 Let’s challenge legacy solutions together and make some waves within payments. ⚡
 



  





**How To Apply** 




 Apply by sending us your CV in Swedish or English.
 



 Our selection process is continuous and we may move forward with candidates on an ongoing basis.
 



  
 



  





**Start:** 
 Immediately with regard to any notice period
 



**Location:** 
 Sveavägen 59, Stockholm

 We believe that our AR technology can change working methods, the way of thinking and enable new innovative solutions that previously was not achievable in industry and machine operation.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
We need an exceptional problem-solver to help build the future of AI software engineering. You'll work across our entire stack to build features that tomorrow’s product builders need. Must be able to ship fast and tackle any technical challenge that comes your way.
 



  





**Why Lovable?** 




  




* **Change the world, literally:** 
 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (According to industry veterans)
* **Work, learn, have fun:** 
 We're building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* **Build a unique network:** 
 Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* **Get autonomy & ownership:** 
 With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* **Compensation:** 
 Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis



  





**What we're looking for:** 




  




* You're a technical Swiss Army knife who can solve any problem thrown at you
* You ship fast and break through walls instead of waiting for doors
* You're familiar with a variety of programming languages and understand fundamental principles behind scalable applications, tech stack, and databases
* You're comfortable not knowing everything but figuring it out anyway
* You have strong opinions about code quality but know when to move fast



  





**Your responsibilities:** 




  




* In one sentence: Do whatever it takes to build a generational product
* Jump between frontend, backend, and infrastructure to build core functionality
* Define, design, and ship new features and participate in full dev lifecycle from planning and design to deployment and maintenance



  





**Our tech stack:** 




  





 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
 



  




* Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces
* Backend: Golang and Rust for serious performance
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Fly.io, Google Cloud Run, AWS, Terraform
* And always exploring what's next



  





**How applying works:** 




  




1. Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
2. We'll send you a quick take-home for (1) a written case study and (2) a loom video presentation
3. Join us for a round of interviews
4. If possible, join us for a week of (paid) trial work. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team & explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you!



  





**About Your Application:** 




  




* Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system
* We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs

title: Associate Software Engineer, Back-End
description:
**About us @Symphony**
 We’ve spent the last 10 years building a communication and markets technology company, powered by interconnected platforms: messaging, voice, directory and analytics. Over 1000 institutions use our modular technology built for global finance. Security is in our DNA with uncompromising data protection, end-to-end encryption and resilient architecture, all created on a foundation of trust with our customers.
   

  

**But that was only chapter one.** 
 We’re now building on our purpose-built network, expanding AI-powered, real-time collaboration, redefining flexibility with fully cloud-native software with our trader voice product, and rethinking the industry’s approach to identity verification, connection and intelligence.
   

  

**The opportunity and our ambition are huge** 
 . But we need passionate, dedicated individuals to get there. At Symphony we work hard and fast. Our unique blend of technology and financial services makes it an environment you won't get elsewhere.
   

  

**Role Description**
 We are seeking an entry level
 **Full-stack Software Engineer (Java/TypeScript)** 
 to join one of our development teams. In this role, you’ll be learning how to design, develop, and maintain server-side services and their frontend counterparts. You will work with a tech lead and senior developers and contractors on one of our Single Page Application products. You will also, together with your team, collaborate with other teams, product managers, and other stakeholders to deliver robust and scalable solutions.
   

  

 The Market Voice and Video team has built the core of Audio and Video communication in the Symphony app using WebRTC. We are a small team of developers that works with Java and media backend services as well as Angular frontend. The team is passionate about CI/CD best practices. We’re looking for talent to join our team to help us change the way the world communicates.
   

  

 We are seeking someone who asks questions, shares own ideas as well as learns from others, proactively communicates, and can be accountable for own deliverables.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 You will be a contributor in our backend development team with following responsibilities:
   

  

* An interest in design, implement and test scalable server-side endpoints (Java, Spring Boot) and their interaction with the Symphony ecosystem
* Had the opportunity to experience some frontend development using Angular
* Collaborate with the product team to gather requirements and other engineering teams to perform product integration
* Investigate issues or performance bottlenecks, document failure analysis, post-mortem, and root cause analysis when required
* Participate constructively and collaboratively in design and code reviews


**Qualifications**
* BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field and 1+ years’ of practical experience in software development
* Some knowledge in either of Java, the Spring Framework (Spring Boot), Typescript and Angular.
* Nice to have: experience working with tools, such as Docker, K8s, Terraform, Git, Jenkins and working in GCP and/or AWS cloud environments.


**Compensation**
* Salary range: 400,000–450,000 SEK per year depending on experience and qualifications
* Bonus Plan: 15% bonus target
* Benefits and Perks vary based on location.


**Benefits And Perks**
* Regional specific competitive benefits
* Build your own Benefits (BYOB) perk
* Many other fun and exciting benefits and activities!


 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.
   

  

 Symphony reserves the right of ownership for all unsolicited resumes submitted for this requisition and is not responsible for any fees associated with unsolicited resumes.
