title: Vikarierande CX Designer
description:
*Till vårt huvudkontor i centrala Stockholm söker vi nu en erfaren och kreativ CX Designer med fokus på UX/UI-design och digital kundupplevelse.*  

  

Är du en designer som drivs av att skapa visuellt tilltalande och användarvänliga koncept och gränssnitt? Har du ett öga för detaljer och vill vara med och forma och utveckla Systembolagets digitala kundupplevelse? Då kan det vara just dig vi söker!  

  

Tjänsten är ett vikariat på ett år med start i mitten på augusti 2025.  

  

**Om rollen**  

Som CX Designer med fokus på UX/UI blir du en del av Koncept & Design-teamet inom Affärsutveckling. Här utvecklar vi digitala kundresor och designar tjänster och upplevelser som stärker vår relevans i en föränderlig värld.  

  

Du arbetar nära andra designers, affärsutvecklare, andra utvecklarroller, specialister och analytiker för att skapa smidiga, inspirerande och ansvarsfulla digitala kundmöten.  

  

**I din roll** kommer du framför allt att arbete med:


* Ta fram inspirerande, tydliga och enkla användargränssnitt (UI).
* Applicera användargränssnitten med responsiv design för olika gränssnitt, tex webb och mobil.
* Säkerställa enhetlig design i linje med vårt koncept, designsystem, visuella identitet och tillgänglighetsprinciper.
* Samla in och analysera kundinsikter för att förstå och identifiera förbättringsmöjligheter för användarupplevelsen. Genomföra användningstester.
* Kartlägga kundresor och identifiera painpoints och utvecklingspotential.
* Skapa wireframes, prototyper och mockups för att testa och iterera idéer.
* Samarbeta med agila utvecklingsteam för att implementera designlösningar.

  

  

**Vi söker dig som**


* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av UX/UI-design, gärna inom e-handel, omnikanal och digitala kundupplevelser.
* Har en stark portfolio som visar din förmåga att skapa användarvänliga och visuellt attraktiva gränssnitt.
* Är expert på Figma, Sketch eller Adobe XD och van vid designsystem.
* Har god förståelse för responsiv design och mobilanpassade gränssnitt.
* Har god förståelse för webbtillgänglighet och WCAG 2.2.
* Förstår hur UI påverkar hela kundupplevelsen och kan skapa smidiga digitala flöden.
* Är van vid att arbeta agilt i tvärfunktionella team med utvecklare och andra specialister.

  

  

**Vad vi står för och hur vi jobbar**  

Genom vår ansvarsfulla försäljning vill vi bidra till bättre folkhälsa och en hållbar utveckling för både människor och miljö. Vi vill upplevas omtänksamma, kunniga och inspirerande i allt vi gör. Våra värderingar hjälper oss att lyckas med Systembolagets viktiga uppdrag.  

  

Systembolaget utvecklas ständigt och det kommer du också att göra. För oss är det viktigt att vi som jobbar här mår bra och att vi skapar balans mellan arbete, familj och fritid. Vi tror starkt på långsiktighet både ur ett socialt och hållbart perspektiv. Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss.


**Känns rollen rätt för dig?**  

Kul! Varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan med CV så snart som möjligt. För att kunna göra en rättvis och likvärdig bedömning av dig som sökande använder vi oss av urvalsfrågor. I ansökningsformuläret kommer du få svara på ett antal frågor om din kompetens och erfarenhet för rollen. Vi kommer att göra urval och intervjuer löpande. - Lägg in att man ska skicka portfolio vid ansökan.


**Bra att veta**  

Tjänsten är en Vikariat på heltid med start i mitten på augusti. Vårt mål är att spegla samhället och vi arbetar aktivt för att främja mångfald och säkerställa likabehandling. Vi välkomnar medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser för att skapa en inkluderande arbetsplats där alla har möjlighet att utvecklas och bidra. Som anställd hos oss på Systembolaget får du ta del av konkurrenskraftiga förmåner såsom, lunch- och friskvårdsbidrag, bra pensions- och semestervillkor.  

  

**Kontakt**  

Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Välkommen att kontakta Linda Bornvik – Enhetschef Affärsutveckling på linda.bornvik@systembolaget.se.


**Välkommen att arbeta hos oss på Systembolaget, ett av Sveriges starkaste varumärken som med omtanke ger service i världsklass!**



 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_



Systembolaget finns till för alla i Sverige för att bidra till bättre folkhälsa genom att begränsa alkoholens skador. Vi bidrar med kunskap och oberoende rådgivning om mat och dryck och hur alkohol påverkar hälsan. På så vis vill vi inspirera till medvetna dryckesval och ett hälsosammare förhållningssätt till alkohol där varken människor eller miljön tar skada. Läs mer om oss på omsystembolaget.se.

title: Senior CMS-konsult & Migreringsexpert
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****10-12 months**
  
Vi söker efter en en senior CMS-konsult med gedigen erfarenhet av att implementera och migrera CMS-lösningar på företagsnivå, med expertis inom headless CMS (Storyblok).


**Start: Inom två veckor**

**Längd: 12 månader till att börja med**

**Plats: Stockholm, 3 dagar i veckan på kontor möjlighet till flex**


Erfarenhet av projektplanering, systemarkitektur och genomförande, för en smidig övergång från äldre plattformar till moderna, skalbara och headless CMS-miljöer.


 5+ års erfarenhet av CMS-implementation och migrering


 Expert inom Storyblok & headless CMS-arkitektur


 Erfarenhet av API-integrationer, innehållsmodellering och frontend-optimering


 Agil projektledning och molnbaserade CMS-lösningar

**Huvudansvar vid CMS-implementation & migrering**

**CMS-implementation & anpassning**

* Analysera verksamhetsbehov och definiera Storyblok CMS-arkitektur & komponentstruktur.
* Utveckla och implementera skräddarsydda Storyblok-komponenter optimerade för skalbarhet och återanvändbarhet.
* Integrera Storyblok med frontend-ramverk (Next.js, React, Vue.js, etc.).

**Webbplatsmigrering**

* Genomföra audits av befintligt CMS, identifiera luckor, redundanser och förbättringsområden.
* Skapa en migrationsstrategi som säkerställer innehållsintegritet, SEO-bevarande och minimalt driftstopp.
* Testa och validera innehållskonsistens, UI/UX-beteende och prestanda efter migreringen.

**Kompetenser**

* CMS-implementation & migrering – Fullständig hantering av CMS-projekt, från kravställning till lansering och optimering.
* Webbplats- och innehållsmigrering – Säker och effektiv migrering från traditionella CMS till headless-miljöer.
* Agil projektledning – Leder tvärfunktionella team och säkerställer effektiva CMS-utrullningar.
* SEO & prestandaoptimering – Säkerställer att CMS-migrering förbättrar SEO, sidladdningstider och innehållsleverans.
* Stakeholder management – Översätter affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar, vilket säkerställer att både teknik och affärsmål uppnås.

**Meriterande**

* Storyblok-expertis – Specialiserad på Storyblok-uppsättning, komponentmodellering, skräddarsydda arbetsflöden och API-integrationer.
* Digital strategi & arkitektur – Designar framtidssäkra CMS-arkitekturer för multispråk, omnichannel och personalisering.

**Tekniska färdigheter**


 CMS & Plattformar: Storyblok


 Frontend-teknologier: React, Vue.js, Next.js,


 Backend & API: RESTful APIs


 SEO & Analytics: Google Analytics, GTM, Lighthouse, Core Web Vitals


 Projektledning: Agile, Scrum, Jira, Confluencess needs into technical solutions, ensuring both technical and business objectives are met.


  
Taher Sateri
Key Account Manager


taher@emagine-consulting.se
+46 72 204 12 40

title: Digital Marknadsföringsspecialist – SEO, Webb & Google Ads
description:

Like It Global hjälper företag att synas och växa genom digital marknadsföring. Vi skapar smarta, AI-drivna lösningar inom SEO, webbdesign och annonsering – och nu söker vi en driven person som kan onboarda nya kunder och ta deras digitala närvaro till nästa nivå!

Trivs med att arbeta självständigt och ta eget ansvar

title: Internship in Malmö - Analytics / Data Quality
description:
**Location:** Malmö  

**Start date:** Autumn 2025  

**Positions to fill:** 1

**About Conversionista**
------------------------


Conversionista is Scandinavia's largest team of conversion optimization specialists. We use data-driven insights and scientific methods to help renowned companies enhance their digital platforms and enable businesses to flourish. Our teams are dedicated to improving user experiences and achieving business growth through actionable insights.

**Internship overview**
-----------------------


We are excited to offer this internship position in our Malmö office. We are looking for an enthusiastic, talented, and motivated intern who wants to learn and progress in one or several of the following areas:

* Web Analytics / Data Analytics / Digital Analytics
* Data Quality / Tracking Implementation


As an intern at Conversionista, you will collaborate with our expert consultants and work directly with established, well-known companies. This hands-on experience will allow you to apply your theoretical knowledge to real-world challenges, bridging the gap between academia and industry.

**What you will do**
--------------------

* Assist in the collection and analysis of qualitative and quantitative data.
* Engage in the optimization processes to improve overall conversion rates.
* Participate in the development and implementation of tracking systems.
* Work alongside senior team members on client projects.

Help make data easily accessible and understandable, enabling crucial business.  
* 

**What we offer**
-----------------

* A learning-centric environment where you will grow as an analyst.
* Exposure to exciting brands and impactful projects.
* A supportive and caring organizational culture, with helpful colleagues across our various teams and competencies (CRO, UX, User Research, Analytics, Data Quality, Advisory).
* A dedicated mentor to guide you throughout your internship and provide skill development coaching.

An opportunity to learn about and contribute to data-driven design and CRO practices.  
* 

**Who you are**
---------------

* Currently studying or recently graduated from a relevant university or vocational education program such as Digital Analytics, Business Analytics, or Data Science.
* Passionate about topics like data analysis, digital optimization, and tracking implementation.
* Has some experience with web analytics tools such as Google Analytics 4 and Google Tag Manager.
* Eager to learn and apply data-driven approaches in identifying and solving customer pain points that will eventually impact the business.
* Excellent communication skills and a professional demeanor.

**Application process**
-----------------------


To apply, please submit your resume along with a cover letter via this portal, explaining why you are applying to Conversionista, what you are most interested in, and how your skills align with those interests.


This position is based in our Malmö office. While we offer the flexibility of working remotely, we encourage working mostly on-site to ensure you get the most out of your internship!

**Note that we can’t process any applications through email or LinkedIn. All applications must be submitted through this portal.**


  
Department
Expert Consulting
Role
Internship (LIA)
Locations
Malmö
Remote status
Hybrid
  
Contact Hanna Nilsson Senior Analytics Specialist – Expert Consulting

title: Graphic Designer (Maternity leave)
description:
CTEK is a global market leader in vehicle charging solutions.
  
Established in Dalarna Sweden, CTEK is the leading global brand in battery charging solutions, most specifically vehicle charging. CTEK offers products ranging from 12V & 24V battery chargers to charging solutions for electrical vehicles. Products are sold via a carefully selected network of global distributors and retailers, as original equipment, supplied to more than 50 of the world’s leading vehicle manufacturers and through charge point operators, property owners as well as other organizations and individuals providing EV charging infrastructure. CTEK takes pride in its unique culture based on a passion for innovation and a deep commitment to supporting the transition to a greener mobility, by adhering to industry leading ESG standards.
  
We are now hiring a Graphic Designer during six months maternity leave (May 1st-Oct 31st) based in the Marketing team at our headquarters in Falun.
  
  

**What You Do:**  

Collaborate with the marketing team to design and develop marketing materials such as social media graphics, digital ads, brochures, packaging, and corporate presentations.
  
Update existing packaging artwork to reflect new design guidelines.
  
Create visually engaging PowerPoint presentations for internal and external use, ensuring brand consistency.
  
Support the Art Director in maintaining and applying brand guidelines across all visual content.
  
Design illustrations, icons, infographics, and layout concepts to elevate marketing campaigns.
  
Assist in standardizing design templates to improve workflow efficiency and organization of digital assets.
  
  

**Who You Are:**  

A creative, detail-oriented Graphic Designer with a passion for visual storytelling.
  
Comfortable working in a collaborative marketing environment, where you will contribute ideas and refine designs based on feedback.
  
A team player who enjoys working closely with others to bring visual projects from concept to final execution.
  
Excited to support a variety of creative projects, from digital ads to print materials, ensuring that all visuals align with the brand’s identity and objectives.
  
  

**Your Skills:**  

Several years of experience in graphic design, ideally in a marketing or creative setting.
  
Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).
  
Experience creating polished presentations in PowerPoint, aligning with corporate and marketing goals.
  
Strong understanding of brand identity, typography, color theory, and layout principles.
  
Basic knowledge of motion graphics or video editing (After Effects) is a plus.
  
Familiarity with UX/UI design principles is an advantage but not required.
  
Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment with strong attention to detail.
  
  

What CTEK can offer you
  
Technology and competence development within latest standards and technologies in the electrification area
  
A learning environment where we cover all product development needed for our products internally. This means we do everything from app, backend, frontend, electronics, mechanics, embedded SW etc.
  
To participate in the green technology shift and its challenges and possibilities for CTEK
  
Great colleagues and a supporting, helping and educational environment.
  
Employee discount on our products
  
Collective agreement (Teknikavtalet)
  
Beneficial electric vehicle charging at the offices
  
  

If this sounds like you, we'd love for you to join our team and contribute to our growing success! Apply now and no later than April 6th. Please submit your application in English.

title: Engineering Manager - AI/LLM to Rillion
description:
We’re building AI-driven features into our platform, and we need an Engineering Manager – AI to lead the way. You’ll head a small, hands-on team that develops AI-powered products within AP (Accounts Payable) automation and enhancing our existing products.
  
Together, we collaborate across the entire product lifecycle—from brainstorming and design to implementation—unlocking AI’s potential in AP automation.
  
If you have a strong background in Python, backend development, and system architecture, plus experience working with LLMs in a cloud environment, we’d love to hear from you.
  
Responsibilities
  
Lead and grow a small cross-functional AI-focused engineering team.
  
Develop and maintain Python backend solutions and APIs for a new product based on a document processing pipeline.
  
Integrate external LLM-based AI services (OpenAI, Azure AI) into our products.
  
Ensure scalability and reliability with cloud-based architectures, infrastructure as code (IaC), and automation (preferably in Azure).
  
Collaborate with product and engineering teams to align AI capabilities with business needs.
  
Mentor and support engineers to foster a high-performing team.
  
  

What You’ll Bring
  
Experience leading backend or AI teams in a product-driven company.
  
Strong Python development skills, with expertise in backend systems and cloud platforms.
  
Hands-on experience integrating LLMs (Azure, AWS, GCP) into production systems.
  
Track record of designing and deploying scalable, API-driven architectures.
  
Ability to balance technical leadership with hands-on coding.
  
  

**Bonus points for:**  

Experience with RAG, tooling, observability, and LLM evaluation.
  
Experience with front-end development (React) and UI/UX considerations.
  
Experience with AI/ML frameworks, e.g. Pytorch, and machine learning.
  
  

**What we offer:**  

Opportunity to build an AI team from the ground up, shaping strategy and execution.
  
A collaborative culture with supportive and talented colleagues.
  
A hybrid work model (2 days per week in the office).
  
A dynamic role where your leadership and technical skills will have a direct impact.
  
  

**The recruitment process:**  

We review applications and invite for interviews continuously.
  
A background check will be conducted on final candidates, pre-employment.
  
If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact recruiter Annie Åström at annie.astrom@rillion.com
  
  

**About Rillion:**  

We are a global company founded in Sweden with 30 years’ experience in the AP Automation industry. We help finance professionals transform how they manage invoices by digitalizing and automating the entire process.
  
By removing the manual steps of invoice handling, we enable finance teams to save time and effort, reducing the possibility of human error. Because we’re AP professionals ourselves, we understand how to give our customers everything they need, and nothing they don’t.
  
Together with our owners at Altor, we´re on a journey to expand in our home markets, while entering new territories. To complete our mission, we need more talented people!
  
Rillion is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.

title: Senior UX Researcher
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

**About the role:**  

**We are looking for a talented and experienced Senior UX Researcher to join our global internal enterprise User Experience team. The Senior UX Researcher will be responsible for leading user research activities to inform the design of our products and services. This role requires an individual with a deep understanding of UX research methods, strong analytical, stakeholder management and research project management skills. You will become a part of a team with colleagues from around the globe that together support our internal employees across all markets and are the voice of the users.**

**About the team:**  

**The global User Experience research team’s mission is to help develop research informed innovative and intuitive internal enterprise experiences. We do this by deploying mixed methods research across the full product development cycle. We are a team of experts in Generative, Formative, Evaluative, and Summative research methods**  

**The global User Experience team’s mission is to make Global IT simple. We do this by focussing on the end-user with the aim of making their lives easier and more productive through outstanding UX and automation.**  



**Your responsibilities**

* **Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify research needs & questions and prioritize research initiatives based on product goals and objectives.**
* **Conduct research and strategy workshops with demonstrable outcomes using appropriate brain storming, prioritization, etc techniques.**
* **Lead multiple user research initiatives that inform product design strategies and decisions from planning, to execution, to analysis & reporting.**
* **Choose or develop right research approach to accurately meet the research need.**
* **Conduct research using wide variety of qualitative and quantitative research methods, including but not limited to, usability testing, surveys, interviews, card sorting, etc.**
* **Establish performance metrics and analytics at research project level and at research workstream level.**
* **Synthesize research findings into actionable insights that inform product design decisions & strategy, improve application performance and enhance user satisfaction.**
* **Effectively communicate research findings and insights to cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and developers.**
**About the team:**  

**The global User Experience research team’s mission is to help develop research informed innovative and intuitive internal enterprise experiences. We do this by deploying mixed methods research across the full product development cycle. We are a team of experts in Generative, Formative, Evaluative, and Summative research methods**  

**The global User Experience team’s mission is to make Global IT simple. We do this by focussing on the end-user with the aim of making their lives easier and more productive through outstanding UX and automation.**

**Your responsibilities**

* **Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify research needs & questions and prioritize research initiatives based on product goals and objectives.**
* **Conduct research and strategy workshops with demonstrable outcomes using appropriate brain storming, prioritization, etc techniques.**
* **Lead multiple user research initiatives that inform product design strategies and decisions from planning, to execution, to analysis & reporting.**
* **Choose or develop right research approach to accurately meet the research need.**
* **Conduct research using wide variety of qualitative and quantitative research methods, including but not limited to, usability testing, surveys, interviews, card sorting, etc.**
* **Establish performance metrics and analytics at research project level and at research workstream level.**
* **Synthesize research findings into actionable insights that inform product design decisions & strategy, improve application performance and enhance user satisfaction.**
* **Effectively communicate research findings and insights to cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and developers.**

**Qualifications**

* **5+ years of experience conducting user research in a UX design or product development environment.**
* **Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Human Factors, Psychology, or a related UX field. (Master’s or PhD Preferred)**
* **Proven track record of leading successful mixed method UX research initiatives that have influenced product design decisions.**
* **Expertise in a variety of research methodologies, including, but not limited to, qualitative and quantitative research methods such as Survey development, Semi-structured interviews, Usability testing, Diary studies, A/B testing, Concept testing, Card sorting, etc.**
* **Experience with user research tools and software, such as Qualtrics, Usertesting.com, DScout, etc.**
* **Knowledge of how to conduct research for service design a plus.**
* **Knowledge of techniques such as Jobs to be done, double diamond a plus**
* **Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.**
* **Excellent written and verbal communication skills.**
* **Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.**
* **Ability to manage research project**
* **Ability to work independently**

**If you are passionate about UX research and have a strong track record of leading successful research initiatives, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.**

**When you join Capgemini, you don’t just start a new job, you become a part of something bigger.**  

**Capgemini’s purpose is to “unleash human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future”. Established in 1967 and now headquartered in Paris, we have become one of the largest technology consulting firms providing services to government, the environment, retail, health, manufacturing and aerospace. We live by our brand values: honesty, boldness, trust, freedom, fun, modesty and team spirit.**  



**GET THE FUTURE YOU WANT**
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
**Seeking a Senior UX Designer to shape the future of digital experiences & product design**

**Why join us?**

**We are a dynamic, forward-thinking team dedicated to transforming complex digital experiences into intuitive and impactful solutions. We thrive on collaboration, curiosity, and pushing the boundaries of design excellence. As part of our team, you’ll work closely with engineers, business analysts, and stakeholders to craft user-friendly, high-quality digital experiences that make a real difference.**

**Our culture is open, flexible, and inclusive—we value humor, positivity, and teamwork as highly as we do performance and outcomes. If you’re passionate about UX, digital design, and creating user-centered solutions, we’d love to have you on board.**

**What’s the job?**

**We’re looking for a** **Senior UX Designer** **who will play a key role in defining and delivering best-in-class digital experiences. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys translating complex information into seamless experiences and has experience leading design initiatives within a fast-paced, collaborative environment.**

**You will:**

* **Lead the design of user-centric experiences** **—wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity UI screens for digital products.**
* **Translate technical concepts** **into intuitive user flows and interfaces.**
* **Collaborate closely** **with developers, product teams, and stakeholders to ensure a cohesive user experience.**
* **Establish and evolve design systems** **to maintain consistency and usability across products.**
* **Conduct and support research and testing efforts** **, helping to validate design decisions with real users.**
* **Drive innovation** **, exploring AI-driven and rapid prototyping tools to accelerate the design process.**
* **Mentor junior designers** **, fostering growth and knowledge-sharing within the team.**

**What we are looking for**

**Your background may be in UX, UI, digital product design, or a similar field, but what’s essential is your ability to create engaging and effective digital experiences at a strategic level.**

**You have:**

* **5+ years of experience in UX/UI or digital product design.**
* **A strong** **portfolio showcasing digital design work** **, including wireframes, prototypes, and UI designs.**
* **Experience with** **design tools like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD** **.**
* **An understanding of** **user-centered design principles and accessibility best practices** **.**
* **A** **strategic mindset** **, able to see the big picture while executing detailed design work.**
* **A** **collaborative mindset** **, eager to work with cross-functional teams.**
* **Strong** **communication skills** **, able to present and articulate design decisions effectively.**
* **Fluency in** **English** **;** **proficiency in Swedish also appreciated** **.**
* **Experience working with** **front-end developers** **to bring designs to life.**
* **Exposure to design systems and component libraries.**
* **Experience facilitating design workshops and stakeholder engagement sessions.**

**Bonus skills**

* **Experience with** **generative AI design tools** **to streamline design processes.**

**What we’re offering**

**We offer a dynamic and collaborative work environment where you can grow and make a real impact.**

* **A hybrid work setup with in-office collaboration in Gothenburg.**
* **The opportunity to** **work on innovative, high-impact digital products** **.**
* **A** **senior role in defining UX and digital design best practices** **.**
* **A** **supportive team environment** **that values learning, experimentation, and creativity.**
* **The chance to explore and implement** **cutting-edge design tools and methodologies** **.**

**If you’re a passionate designer eager to take UX and digital design to the next level, we’d love to hear from you!**

**Are you ready to make your mark?**

**We know some might hesitate to apply unless they meet every single requirement. If that sounds familiar, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be a better fit than you think—and we’d love to hear from you. We review applications on an ongoing basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible! Please submit your application and CV in English.**

**Capgemini (traded as** **CAP on the Euronext Paris** **) is a leading strategic partner to companies around the world, we have leveraged technology to enable business transformation since our inception in Paris, more than 50 years ago. As the advisory and digital strategy, transformation, innovation, and creative brand of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent enables CxOs to envision and shape the future of their businesses. Located in nearly 40 studios and more than 60 offices around the world, it comprises a 12,000+ strong team of** **strategists, data scientists, product and experience designers, brand experts and technologists** **who develop new digital services, products, experiences and business models for sustainable growth.**

**Get to know us better! Please visit** **www.capgemini.com/invent** **, or listen in to an episode of our podcast** **Future Sight with Capgemini Invent** **, available on Spotify.**

**#LI-DNI**
company_description: At Capgemini Invent, we bring together a diverse collective of disruptors, change-makers, and movers and shakers with diverse backgrounds, skills, and passions – forming an innovation

title: Graphic Designer
description:
**Job Description**
 As a Graphic Designer you will be responsible for communicating our brand direction and identity through graphic design. You will;
   

  

* Develop design to meet commercial or promotional needs. Focus in digital, animations and moving media. Meriting if you also have experience within other areas such as packaging, displays, signs, or imagery for print, but not a must.
* Work closely with art directors and creative leads to communicate ideas, creating visual text and imagery concepts that inspire and captivate consumers and collaborate with project managers, production managers, copywriters and a creative lead.
* Read design briefs, determine requirements and conceptualize visuals based on requirements.
* Develop visual ideas, using the appropriate design elements and layouts, ensuring that final graphics and layouts are visually appealing and on-brand
* Testing designs across various media
* Create guidelines for how to work with our graphic elements and our brand identity in different media.


**Qualifications**
**WHO YOU ARE**
*We are looking for people with…*
* 5+ years working as a graphic designer or brand designer, effectively developing but also translating design principles into different channels.
* Bachelor's degree in Design, Final art or a related field.
* A portfolio of work that shows consistent application of a brand direction into multi-channel formats.
* Technical proficiency - Experience of working with relevant design software and technologies (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, After effects, Premiere pro, Figma).
* A demonstrated eye for details, design craft and fashion aesthetics
* Ability to drive the development of a brand direction, making independent design choices and directing the implementation of this direction across multi-channel applications.


*And people who are…*
* Highly collaborative – A true team player who thrives in cross-functional settings and can build strong relationships with internal teams and external partners alike.
* Solution-oriented and adaptable – Able to navigate challenges with a flexible mindset, always finding a way forward even in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
* Detail-focused yet strategic – Balancing a keen eye for detail with the ability to see the bigger picture, ensuring consistency, quality, and alignment across all touchpoints.
* Proactive and self-driven – Taking initiative, anticipating needs, and bringing ideas to the table to continuously improve processes and outcomes.
* Curious and growth-minded – Open to learning and evolving, embracing new tools, methods, and ways of working to stay ahead in an ever-changing industry.


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **Fulltime Permanent Position** 
 , based at our Head Office in Stockholm, starting as soon as possible. Apply by sending in your  CV in English by 26th March. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.
* In addition to our global benefits, our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. (Example: Competitive compensation for your dedication and long-term commitment. A day off on your birthday to relax and celebrate your special day. Special gift to celebrate the birth of your child, etc.)


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Product Designer to Photowall
description:
**Product Designer**
 At Photowall, we are more than just a global leader in custom-made wallpapers and wall murals — we’re passionate about transforming spaces and bringing design to life. With a presence in over 20 markets we’re on an exciting journey of growth. Our vision is to keep expanding, both geographically and through innovative new products. As proud members of the Network of Design (NOD), we are constantly pushing the boundaries of interior design to create inspiring and meaningful spaces. At Photowall, we offer a dynamic, fast-paced environment where personal growth and development are key.
   

  

**How will you take us to the next level?**
 As a Product Designer at Photowall, you will play a crucial role in shaping the future of our e-commerce platform. You will focus on creating intuitive and visually appealing user experiences, ensuring that our platform remains easy to use, efficient, and conversion-optimized. Your work will directly impact our customers’ journey — from inspiration to purchase — by improving usability, accessibility, and engagement.
   

  

 You will work closely with developers, marketers, and product owners, using data-driven insights and user feedback to refine and enhance our platform. Your ability to balance business needs, customer insights, and design best practices will be essential in delivering world-class experiences.
   

  

**Your focus areas**
* End-to-end design Drive the full design process, from idea and wireframes to high-fidelity UI design and prototyping.
* User-centered problem-solving Conduct research and usability testing to understand user behaviors, needs, and pain points.
* E-commerce optimization Design interfaces and interactions that improve conversion rates, retention, and engagement.
* Scalability & consistency Develop and maintain design systems and UI components that ensure a cohesive experience across all touchpoints.
* Collaboration & iteration Work closely with developers, product owners, and stakeholders to test, refine, and validate designs before implementation.


**What We Are Looking For**
 We believe you have at least 5 years of experience in product or UX/UI design, with a strong focus on digital products and e-commerce. You have a data-driven mindset and the ability to design solutions that are both visually compelling and highly functional.
   

  

**Must-have Qualifications**
* Strong UX and UI design skills, with a portfolio showcasing e-commerce or SaaS experience
* Proficiency in Figma
* Experience conducting user research, usability testing and A/B testing
* Knowledge of design systems and component-based UI design
* Strong ability to translate business needs into intuitive user experiences


**Bonus Points For**
* Familiarity with AI-driven personalization and dynamic content
* Experience with conversion rate optimization (CRO) and analytics tools
* Previous work in e-commerce, marketplaces or digital retail
* Familiarity with HTML, CSS and front-end frameworks to collaborate effectively with developers


**Why Photowall?**
 At Photowall, we’re a close-knit team that values collaboration and creativity. You’ll have the chance to shape our future and influence the development of our technical platform, all while working in a company that’s committed to the ever-evolving world of interior design. If you’re passionate about design and eager to grow, Photowall is the place for you. We can’t wait to welcome you aboard as a key player in our exciting journey!
   

  

 Apply today and help us shape the future of design at Photowall!

title: Global Digital Designer
description:
Are you an experienced Digital Designer with a passion for the great outdoors and digital innovation? Fjällräven’s Marketing Department is looking for a Global Digital Designer to join our creative team for nine months to cover a parental leave. This is your opportunity to shape digital experiences while working with a brand committed to sustainability, functionality, and design excellence.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Digital Designer, you will be responsible for driving Fjällräven’s creative digital vision, crafting visually engaging, user-focused experiences across multiple platforms. You will collaborate closely with teams across eCommerce, global marketing, UX/UI, and development to ensure that every digital asset aligns with our brand identity and engages our customers.
   

  

 This role provides an exciting opportunity to contribute to digital marketing campaigns and content creation while managing the tools and systems that enhance Fjällräven’s digital presence and impact.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with the Global Visual Design team, Copywriters, and Creative Leads to develop innovative and engaging content for campaigns and digital marketing across multiple channels.
* Act as the primary contact for eCommerce design, optimizing digital assets such as landing pages, ads, and email marketing to align with our values and customer needs.
* Oversee the Marigold Engage system and drive UX/UI improvements.
* Manage digital design tools such as Figma and Optimizely, as well as other relevant platforms like Sanity, working closely with teams to streamline design processes.
* Work with internal teams (designers, copywriters, eCommerce) to align digital strategies with business goals while ensuring technical consistency with platform requirements.
* Stay ahead of industry trends and emerging technologies such as AR, VR, and AI to enhance user experiences and strengthen the brand’s digital presence.


**Who You Are**
 As a Global Digital Designer, you are a proactive, self-motivated creative professional who thrives in dynamic environments. You have a deep understanding of visual design and are comfortable working across both the creative and technical aspects of digital design. Your ability to lead cross-functional initiatives across multiple channels and manage multiple projects will be key to your success.
   

  

**Qualifications & Skills** 
 :
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in Visual Design, Interactive Design, or a related field.
* 5–7 years of experience as a Digital Designer in an agency or in-house role.
* Strong expertise in creating engaging digital content across web, email, and social media.
* Proficiency in digital design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, XD), Sketch, InVision, and Figma.
* Experience in photo and video editing, with an understanding of best practices in digital content creation.
* A strong portfolio showcasing digital design work across multiple platforms.
* Excellent communication skills in English; additional languages are a plus.


**Personal Attributes:**
* You are confident in taking ownership of projects while fostering collaboration across teams.
* You approach challenges with creativity and an innovative mindset, always seeking solutions that benefit both the brand and the customer.
* You simplify complex ideas and communicate them effectively to a variety of stakeholders.
* You bring positive energy to team environments, contributing to shared goals with enthusiasm.
* You stay organized and manage multiple projects effectively, even in high-pressure situations.
* You have a keen eye for detail while maintaining a strategic perspective in your design decisions.


 This position is based at our office in Solna.
   

  

 If you are a talented Digital Designer with a strong creative vision, we encourage you to apply through our career page in English. We look forward to reviewing your application!
   

  

 In 1960,
 *Åke Nordin* 
 founded
 *Fjällräven* 
 in his basement in the town of
 *Örnsköldsvik* 
 in northern
 *Sweden.* 
 Today the company’s timeless, functional and durable outdoor equipment enjoys a global presence and can be found in over 70 countries.
   

  

 Fjällräven’s product range comprises outdoor clothing and accessories for men and women as well as backpacks, tents and sleeping bags. As a company, Fjällräven makes every effort to act responsibly towards people, wildlife and the environment and to encourage people to take an interest in outdoor life.
   

  

 The company is the initiator of two popular outdoor events,
 *Fjällräven Classic* 
 and
 *Fjällräven Polar* 
 , which attract thousands of participants every year. Fjällräven is part of
 *Fenix Outdoor AB* 
 .

title: Brand Designer
description:
**About Cellcolabs**
 Cellcolabs is a leading biotech impact scale-up on a mission to revolutionize healthcare through the large-scale production of Mesenchymal Stem Cells (MSCs). MSCs have shown great potential in preventing and treating a range of diseases and conditions. By scaling MSC production, we enable broader use in advanced therapies - paving the way for more widespread adoption in healthcare.
   

  

 With 20 years of research from the Karolinska Institute as our foundation, Cellcolabs is approved for GMP production of Investigational Advanced Therapy Medicinal Products (IATMPs) by the Swedish Medical Products Agency. Backed by Sweden’s top health and life science entrepreneurs, along with impact investor Norrsken Launcher, we are headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, and operate globally.
   

  

**Join Our Team as a Brand Designer**
 We are looking for a hands-on brand designer who thrives in a fast-paced startup environment and can develop creative, innovative concepts that align with our business strategy. As part of the Marketing and Communications team, you will be responsible for shaping the visual expression of our brand, ensuring it remains consistent and impactful across all touchpoints.
   

  

 You’ll have the opportunity to create new and engaging ways to connect with our global audiences in both B2B and B2C markets, developing a digital-first brand experience that reflects our heritage and mission.
   

  

 You’ll play a key role in bringing our brand to life through compelling creative executions, helping us redefine how we communicate and connect with stakeholders worldwide. This is a unique opportunity to make a tangible impact in shaping the future of our brand.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 Brand Development: Take ownership of our visual expression, developing it from initial concept through to execution.
   

  

 Ideation Experience: Bring ideation experience and be able to conceptualize strong, impactful ideas that translate into top digital touchpoints.
   

  

 Set Visual Standards: Play a fundamental role in establishing and maintaining visual standards for our performance marketing efforts.
   

  

 Consistency Across Touchpoints: Ensure brand consistency in visual communications across various platforms.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
* A team player with a forward-leaning attitude. You approach challenges with a proactive attitude, striving to push creative boundaries while refining and elevating ideas. You excel at translating high-level strategy into thoughtfully crafted and impactful executions.
* You have to love both the big picture and the finer details. This role demands thoughtfulness, as well as the ability to quickly identify what’s needed to solve a problem. You need to be comfortable articulating your ideas, making creative decisions and craft solutions that connect with our target audience.
* Expertise in Photoshop, Illustrator, and After Effects is essential; proficiency in Cinema 4D is highly preferred.
* 3–5 years of documented full-time experience in an advertising agency or in-house brand team.
* Ideally, you have experience in developing global multi-channel campaigns for both B2C and B2B markets


 Note: A portfolio highlighting your direct contributions is an essential element of the application for a design role at Cellcolabs. Applicants who don’t provide a link or PDF with work samples unfortunately won’t be considered.

title: Design Engineer
description:
We're looking for an excellent engineer with exceptional sense for UX and design, who can turn new ideas into powerful user experiences without designer handoffs. You'll own our frontend while building full-stack features that make AI development with Lovable feel magical.
 



  





**Why Lovable?** 




  




* **Change the world, literally:** 
 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (According to industry veterans)
* **Work, learn, have fun:** 
 We’re building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* **Build a unique network:** 
 Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* **Get autonomy & ownership:** 
 With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* **Compensation:** 
 Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis



  





**What we're looking for:** 




  




* You're that rare engineer who thinks in systems AND pixels
* You ship beautiful interfaces without needing a designer to hold your hand
* You're comfortable jumping between frontend and backend (We're happy to coach you on backend!)
* You have strong opinions about both UX patterns and code architecture
* You're obsessed with the details that make great products feel magical



  





**Your responsibilities:** 




  




* Own our frontend architecture and make it a joy for others to build on
* Ensure that Lovable's UX is unmatched by any other AI engineering platform
* Create component systems that scale with our rapid growth
* Make our product feel faster and smoother with every release
* Help shape our technical architecture as we push the boundaries of AI



  





**Our tech stack:** 




  





 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
 



  




* Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces
* Backend: Golang and Rust for serious performance
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Fly.io, Google Cloud Run, AWS, Terraform
* And always exploring what's next



  





**How applying works:** 




  




1. Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
2. We'll send you a quick take-home for (1) a written case study and (2) a loom video presentation
3. Join us for a round of interviews
4. If possible, join us for a week of (paid) trial work. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team & explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you



  





**About Your Application:** 




  




* Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system
* We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs

title: Localization Product Manager
description:
**About Us**
 Keystone Education Group is a global leader in helping students find the right education, dedicated to delivering an exceptional experience to users worldwide. Our mission is to make our products accessible and engaging for diverse audiences by ensuring seamless localization and translation across our website and internal systems.
   

  

 We’re looking for a Localization Product Manager to drive our localization efforts, providing key insights and recommendations on translation strategies and improving how our content resonates with international audiences.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Analyze and assess localization needs across our website and internal systems.
* Provide data-driven recommendations to optimize localization, translation quality, and consistency.
* Execution & Ownership: Ability to not only recommend improvements but also manage daily localization tasks in product development.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, UX, content, and marketing, to ensure localization is the best practices.
* Identify and implement process improvements in translation workflows, tools, and vendor management.
* Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of localization efforts, leveraging analytics and user feedback.
* Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies in localization and translation.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Experience: at least 2 years in localization, product management, or a related field.
* Knowledge of at least one industry TMS (Lokalise, Crowdin, Smartling, etc.)
* Terminology bases and translation memories management.
* Machine translation post-editing (MTPE), LLM-based translations and prompt engineering
* Expertise: Strong understanding of localization strategies, translation processes, and related tools.
* Analytical Mindset: Ability to interpret data, identify trends, and make informed recommendations.
* Communication Skills: Clear and concise communication with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Problem-Solving: A proactive approach to identifying and resolving localization challenges.
* Collaboration: Comfortable working cross-functionally to align localization efforts with business goals.
* Experience with localization platforms and CMS tools.


**Nice-to-Haves**
* Familiarity with agile product development methodologies.
* Willingness to take on tasks and responsibilities from other product areas when needed.
* Fluency in one or more languages other than English.


**What can we offer you?**
* An International and open working atmosphere with colleagues of many nationalities.
* To be a part of a fast-growing company.
* Plenty of space for initiative and the ability to grow your own skills and experience.
* Awesome colleagues and a social working environment.
* Hybrid working, but with a team that also enjoys meeting up IRL and having a Friday beer or Monday breakfast at the office found centrally in Stockholm (or in Sheffield).
* To be a part of a team who cares deeply for our customers.


**What's the team like?**
 You will join the Publishing Squad and be a part of a larger Product & tech team consisting of 30+ engineers and product managers from diverse backgrounds and experiences.
   

  

 Collaborative, ambitious and driven best describes us. You will be joining a strong and growing team with great chemistry who are passionate about what they do and always go the extra mile to reach their goals.
   

  

**Keystone Education Group**
 Keystone is trusted by more than 120 million unique prospective students every year to help students and learners make one of the most important decisions of their lifetimes, namely, which higher education degree program or course to attend.
   

  

 In turn, Keystone helps over 5 500 education institutions reach, recruit, and enroll students in more than 190 countries, across 500+ student websites, including Masterstudies.com, Bachelorstudies.com, Educations.com, Studentum.se, and FindAMasters. Keystone also operates a range of other global student recruitment services, including Blueberry.nu, Keystone Sports and Keystone Apply.
   

  

 Headquartered in Oslo, Norway, Keystone is backed by Viking Venture and Verdane, two leading Nordic venture firms. With offices across the Nordics, Germany, and the UK, Keystone has an international staff of more than 800+ employees. We are a vibrant and talented group of global citizens with a true passion for education and technology, and our vision is to help everyone in the world find the right education.
   

  

 Please send us your application, in English, by hitting the button "Apply here!".
   

  

*Keystone is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are deeply committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all employees.*

title: Product Manager - Gdansk, Stockholm OR Oslo/Larvik
description:
As a Product Manager at ABAX, you'll play a key role in shaping platform products, APIs, and customer-enabling tools. You'll collaborate closely with engineering and product teams to streamline workflows, reduce cognitive load, and enhance the customer experience. Since adopting the product operating model in 2023, we’ve built an environment where product managers are truly empowered to drive impact.
   

  

 We're looking for a passionate, outcome-driven leader who thrives on solving complex problems. You take ownership, think strategically, and work seamlessly as a product trio with engineering and design leads. With a customer-first, data-driven mindset, you're adaptable, curious, and focused on delivering real value—balancing quick wins with long-term growth.
   

  

**Some of the things you will be working on:**
* Developing and executing a comprehensive product strategy aligned with the company's goals and customer needs.
* Conducting market research to identify industry trends, customer pain points, and competitive insights.
* Managing the end-to-end product development lifecycle, from concept to launch, working closely with cross-functional teams throughout the value chain.
* Creating and maintaining a product roadmap, setting priorities and releases for feature releases and then iterate to achieve wanted outcomes.
* Collaborating with stakeholders to define product features, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
* Ensuring a seamless and user-friendly product experience by working with UX/UI designers and engineering stakeholders.


**Experiences we’re looking for:**
* High technical ability, ideally with a background in a software development role, with proven experience in developing cross-platform products.
* Practical experience from working with the product operating model, whilst working with product teams.
* Strong understanding of Single-Sign-On solutions and similar platform wide services.


**We believe you bring:**
* Bachelor's or master's degree in information security, management, computer science, engineering, or equivalent related discipline.
* Relevant experience as a Product Manager or Senior Engineer for services targeting Developer and Customer agent personas.
* Strong proficiency in cloud platforms such as Google Cloud Platform, AWS, or Azure


**Other information:**
* Start date: As soon as possible / As agreed.
* Work extent: Full time.
* Remote Status: Hybrid, which means that you are welcome to work from home some days while we would like to collaborate with you some days at the office. Remote setup is negotiable depending on location.
* Location: Flexible. Preferably Gdansk, Poland, but can also be located in Stockholm, Sweden , or Larvik, Norway.


**Background check and Reference verification:**
 Successful employment is contingent upon ABAX receiving satisfactory references.
   

  

 As part of our hiring process, we perform a digital reference check through RefApp, and advance online solution for managing this procedure.
   

  

 Please be aware that a background check may be conducted simultaneously with the reference check.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities:**
 At ABAX, we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. This commitment extends to ensuring that our recruitment practices and processes are as inclusive as possible. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to join us in strengthening our focus on equality and diversity in the workplace.
   

  

**About ABAX:**
 ABAX is a leading European telematics IoT platform offering connected mobility solutions for vehicle tracking, tool tracking, and equipment control. Our mission is to deliver mobility data insights that empower people to do more with less.
   

  

 With over 500,000 tracked assets and 40,000 customers, ABAX delivers reliable and powerful solutions for businesses relying on physical operations. Our advanced platform transforms customer needs into actionable insights and automated reporting, driving efficiency and operational excellence.
   

  

 We operate across Europe, with over 350 employees working from our facilities in Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Poland, and the UK. Our Head Office is in Larvik, Norway.

title: Product Manager - Financial Products
description:
**Juni who? 👋**
 At Juni, we’re busy building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.
   

  

**How & Why We Do It 🚀**
 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
   

  

**Your role at a glance 🤸‍♀️**
 You'll work closely with designers, engineers, specialist stakeholders, and the Product director to develop Banking capabilities and financial products, which form a core part of our platform and value proposition. You will act as the voice of our customers and be a stable bridge between engineering and the business. You will also help the team function as an empowered product team by setting the right product culture and vision, and help the team deliver high quality impactful features.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities 👏**
 In this role, you’ll stand over the Financial product suite at Juni. Your R&R would cover:
   

  

* Product Strategy and Vision: Defining the strategic direction of financial products, aligning them with the company's overall business strategy. This involves creating product roadmaps that outline planned features and enhancements based on customer feedback, competitors, market demands and business priorities.
* Customer Experience: Lead the vision for financial experience within the platform- bank transfer, invoice payment, credit usage etc. Ensure the financial and banking features are chain-linked into cohesive end-to-end workflows. Work with designers to build UX that WoWs customers.
* Financial Product Ecosystem: Unpacking the Swedish banking ecosystem and liaising with regulators, Swedish banks and payment third parties, to unlock new payment rails and banking partnerships. This would require you to attend events, conferences and build a strong network in the payment eco-system. The same will need to be replicated for our other GTM geographies.
* Empowered Product Team: Setting the right product culture within your product team that empowers all team members to empathise with customer pain points and understand the impact of features they are building.
* Customer Research: Conduct thorough customer research to understand customer (ICP) needs, market trends, and the competitive landscape in the financial product space. This includes gathering insights through customer interviews, surveys, and data analysis.
* Cross-functional collaboration: Working closely with various departments such as engineering, design, commercial, and finance to ensure effective product development and launch. This includes facilitating communication and alignment among different teams.
* Product Development Oversight: Managing the product backlog, prioritizing features, and working closely with development teams to ensure timely and high-quality delivery of banking products
* Market Positioning and training: Developing strategies for positioning and pricing banking and financial products in the market. Ensuring that the commercial teams have been trained on product features and value propositions clearly understood by all.


**Within 1 Month You Will**
* Understand how Juni’s product teams work
* Be integrated with your team
* Ship your first financial features 🚢


**Within 3 Months You Will Have**
* Stronghold of your teams' growth metrics
* Deep understanding of your team’s roadmap
* Shipped many features and fix critical bugs 🐛


**Within 6 Months You Will**
* Oversee delivery against your metrics and roadmap (with some bumps along the way)
* Set 12-month rolling vision for Banking and Financial product domain
* Actively participate in customer research to understand the voice of customer


**Tooling ⚙️**
* Google suite
* Notion
* BI tools
* Slack


**Qualifications 👑**
 What we need to see:
   

  

* Familiarity with fintech and financial services (preferably from Sweden)
* Good understanding of Swedish and global payment eco-system
* 3+ years of product manager experience
* Understanding of payment rails


**What We’d Love To See**
* Familiarity with financial and spend management products (preferably from Sweden)
* 5+ years of overall experience
* Experience with Bankgiro, Rix-inst, Swift, any other payment rails
* Engineering or computer science degree


**Your people 👥**
 Our team is as ambitious as our amazing customers. We aim high and we move with speed to make our vision a reality. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
   

  

**Your Benefits 😍**
 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
   

  

* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation days. 30 days contractually. Awesome.
* Private Health insurance. You know. Just in case
* Beautiful offices in central Gothenburg and Stockholm, front row sea view!


 At Juni, we’re building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.

title: Senior Frontend Utvecklare - Till Carnegie Investment Bank
company_industry: Financial Services, Investment Banking, and Banking
description:
**Om Carnegie** 




 Carnegie är en av Nordens främsta finansiella rådgivare och förvaltare. Våra olika verksamheter tillhör, var för sig, marknadsledarna inom sitt respektive område Du hittar mer information på: www.carnegie.se
 



  





**Vad är Carnegie Tech?** 




 Carnegie Tech levererar moderna IT-lösningar och professionella tjänster för Carnegies kärnverksamhet, vilket involverar i hela kedjan från idé till färdig produkt. På Carnegie Tech i Stockholm arbetar ca 70 personer, arbetssättet är agilt i en organisation som genomsyras av en öppen, kreativ och affärsdriven arbetsmiljö.
 



  





 Vårt fina kontor är beläget mitt i centrala Stockholm och på Carnegie Tech har du möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.
 



  





**Om Rollen** 




 I rollen som Senior Frontend Utvecklare kommer du att arbeta med Carnegies externa kundgränssnitt. Tillsammans med affären skapar du grymma applikationerna för våra slutkunder. Du får möjlighet att jobba med vår externa webbplattform och mobilapplikation, där fokus ligger på att skapa så mycket värde som möjligt för vårt kundsegment och att utveckla applikationer som ger en exklusiv känsla för våra kunder.
 



  





 Här blir du en del av ett tight team där du är med i hela kedjan från idé, design, utveckling till release. Teamet består av mycket kompetenta medarbetare som tillsammans strävar efter att leverera de bästa IT-lösningarna och produkterna för att möta företagets och våra kunders behov.
 



  





 Vi arbetar i en modern plattform, nära affären och med den senaste tekniken. Ditt fokus ligger på att programmera och producera högkvalitativ kod, särskilt inom JavaScript och React. Tillsammans med dina kollegor löser ni komplexa problem, tar viktiga beslut och säkerställer att ni har rätt förutsättningar för att kunna utföra ett högkvalitativt arbete.
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Med ett stort intresse för tekniska lösningar och en vilja att ständigt hålla dig uppdaterad inom den senaste tekniken, har du även ett intresse för finans och kanske erfarenhet från branschen. Du trivs i en föränderlig miljö och din kommunikativa förmåga gör det möjligt att effektivt samverka med olika intressenter. Vidare är du/har du:
 



  




* Lång erfarenhet inom frontend utveckling (främst inom JavaScript och React)
* Positiv, affärsorienterad, prestigelös och lösningsorienterad
* Intresse för att bygga bra användargränssnitt och design
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Git
* Flytande kunskaper både svenska och engelska
* Tidigare erfarenhet av eller ett intresse för finansbranschen
* Relevant akademisk utbildning alternativt ett långt brinnande intresse som skapat erfarenhet



  





**Meriterande kunskaper** 



* Erfarenheter av komponentbibliotek
* Kunskaper och erfarenhet av DevOps och effektiva arbetsflöden
* Kunskaper i C#, .NET
* Kunskaper inom UX/UI
* Erfarenhet av molnlösningar, särskilt inom Azure



  





 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du trivas i en föränderlig miljö där du har möjlighet att ha en stor påverkan.
 



  





**Vårt erbjudande** 




 Vi erbjuder en mångsidig roll i en dynamisk arbetsmiljö i en platt organisation med korta beslutsvägar. Hos Carnegie har du möjlighet att genom egna insatser påverka resultat och din individuella utveckling. Du får ett omväxlande arbete med utrymme för egna initiativ och stort ansvarstagande med frihet under ansvar. Vidare erbjuder vi:
 



  




* Flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till distansarbete
* Friskvårdsbidrag och förmånliga rabatter
* Konkurrenskraftig tjänstepension och Föräldrabidrag
* Hälso- & Privatvårdsförsäkring med hälsokontroll
* Möjlighet till rörlig ersättning
* En mängd roliga sociala aktiviteter och föreningar
* Carnegie personal development: en mängd olika utbildningar/kurser som erbjuds



  





 För att säkerställa en hög kvalitet och objektivitet i vår rekryteringsprocess, använder vi oss av tester och slutkandidat omfattas även av en bakgrundskontroll. Denna rekrytering sker med löpande urval, varför vi gärna ser att du skickar din ansökan snarast, dock senast den 24 april 2025.
 



  





 Om du har några frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Jill Holmgren, jilhol@carnegie.se, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner.
 



  





 (Kontakt fr konsultbolag/rekryteringsbolag/rekryterare undanbedes)
 



  





*Carnegie värnar om mångfald och att ta tillvara människors olika erfarenheter, kunskaper och egenskaper. Utifrån dessa kan vi skapa en kreativ och utvecklande arbetsmiljö som ökar förutsättningarna att uppnå ett optimalt resultat.* 




  





**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Säljare med fokus på Time & Material
description:
**Vill du vara med och bygga något stort?**
 Nion är ett nytänkande IT-konsultbolag som kombinerar spetskompetens med äkta engagemang – både för våra kunder och våra medarbetare. I början av 2024 gick One Agency, Nordicstation och Polar Cape samman och bildade en europeisk koncern med över 200 anställda, 50 underkonsulter och 150 unika kunder. Tillsammans är vi starkare, snabbare och ännu mer relevanta.
   

  

 För att växla upp vår tillväxtresa söker vi nu en
 **vass säljare** 
 till vårt team i Stockholm med fokus på Time & Material-affären. Du får möjlighet att påverka, göra avtryck och vara med och forma framtidens Nion.
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra**
 I rollen som säljare blir du en nyckelperson i vår fortsatta expansion – där din insats direkt påverkar både affär och kultur.
   

  

* Driva och realisera din egen sälj-pipeline inom resurskonsultaffären (Time & Material), främst i Stockholmsregionen.
* Skapa och underhålla starka kundrelationer – du är ständigt top of mind hos både nya och befintliga kunder.
* Samarbeta med våra interna team vid teamförsäljning och hjälpa till att matcha rätt konsult med rätt uppdrag.
* Tillsammans med våra konsulter ta fram säljande konsultprofiler och presentationer som lyfter både individen och vårt erbjudande.


**Din bakgrund – det här tror vi du har med dig**
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av operativ försäljning inom IT-konsultbranschen, med fokus på resurskonsulter på Time & Material-basis.
* Ett aktivt nätverk av kunder och partners – du vet vem du ska ringa och de tar gärna dina samtal.
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat med säljprocesser och mål – du har koll på din pipe och driver affärer hela vägen i mål.
* God teknisk förståelse – du kan prata frontend, backend, mobilutveckling, arkitektur, QA, UI/UX, produktägarskap och agile roller utan att blinka.


**Vi är Nion**
 På Nion kombinerar vi teknisk spetskompetens med ett starkt engagemang för att hjälpa våra kunder nå framgång. Vi är stolta över att vara en flexibel partner på den digitala resan, där vi erbjuder både individuella specialister som förstärker kundens team och kompletta, välkoordinerade team från våra interna utvecklingsteam. Våra lösningar sträcker sig från avancerad affärsautomation och AI till skräddarsydd systemutveckling, stabil drift och support samt dataarkitektur och analys som omvandlar data till insiktsfulla beslut.
   

  

 Med över 200 skickliga konsulter och kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Oslo, Skopje och Bitola, har vi hjälpt företag världen över att växa genom innovation, samarbete och ett passionerat fokus på resultat. Våra kärnvärden –
 **samarbete** 
 ,
 **engagemang** 
 och
 **innovation** 
 – driver oss att ständigt leverera lösningar som gör skillnad, både för våra kunder och för våra medarbetare.
   

  

**Vårt löfte till dig**
 Våra Fantastiska Medarbetare Är Hjärtat i Vår Framgång. Därför Gör Vi Allt För Att Skapa En Arbetsplats Där Du Känner Dig Inspirerad, Uppskattad Och Ständigt Växer. När Du Jobbar På Nion Får Du
   

  

* Kompetensutveckling – Utbildningar, workshops och individuella utvecklingsplaner för att nå dina mål.
* En stark gemenskap – Teamkänsla, AW:s, gamingkvällar, konferenser och fester.
* Globala möjligheter – Med kunder över hela världen är variation och spännande projekt en självklarhet.
* Livsbalans – Flexibla arbetstider, friskvårdsbidrag och välmåendefokuserade initiativ.
* Generösa förmåner – 30 dagars semester, tjänstepension, årsbonus, möjlighet till delägarskap och mycket mer.


 Hos oss handlar det om att ha roligt samtidigt som vi tillsammans levererar lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****4-6 months**
  
We are looking for an experienced Senior Backend Engineer for one of our great tech clients.


This position entails working with modern cloud-based infrastructure, event-driven architectures, and high-performance APIs.


A self-motivated individual with strong problem-solving abilities who can easily adapt to new technologies will thrive in this role. Effective communication is essential as collaboration with multiple teams is expected.

**Start: ASAP**

**Duration: 6 months, extension possible**

**Location: Malmö, 2-3 days/week onsite required**

**About the assignment**
------------------------

* Design, develop, and maintain high-performance backend systems using Java, Spring Boot, and Kotlin.
* Build and optimize gRPC for internal services and REST for external systems.
* Integrate Kafka for messaging within an event-driven architecture.
* Manage and optimize MySQL databases, ensuring efficient data storage and retrieval.
* Deploy and manage services within a Kubernetes (K8s) environment utilizing Istio for service mesh capabilities.
* Use Amazon S3 for backend storage solutions and implement monitoring via Micrometer, Prometheus, and Grafana.
* Ensure quality and reliability of backend services through performance optimization and debugging efforts.
* Collaborate closely with frontend engineers, DevOps teams, and product managers.
* Promote software development best practices and document technical solutions comprehensively.

**Your profile:**
-----------------

* 7+ years of backend software development experience with Java (JDK) and Spring Boot expertise.
* Strong understanding of concurrent programming, Java collections, and performance optimizations.
* Experience with microservices development and transitioning to Kotlin where applicable.
* Proficient in MySQL database management, including schema design and query optimization.
* Hands-on experience with event-driven architectures and utilizing Kafka.
* Familiarity with deploying applications in Kubernetes (K8s) and using Istio.
* Strong knowledge of gRPC and REST APIs.
* Experience with monitoring tools such as Micrometer, Prometheus, and Grafana.
* Familiar with CI/CD pipelines, Docker, and GitLab.
* Understanding of Agile methodologies and test-driven development (TDD) with JUnit.

**Nice to Haves**
-----------------

* Experience with GraphQL for backend-for-frontend (BFF) architectures.
* Knowledge of Liquibase for database versioning.
* Strong scripting skills in Bash and Python for automation purposes.
* Familiarity with React and Material-UI to enhance frontend collaboration.

**Other Details**
-----------------

* **Experience:** Proven track record in backend development, testing, and deployment.
* **Mindset:** Strong problem-solving abilities, effective communication, self-driven, team-oriented, and adaptable.

title: Data Engineer till Uddeholms Data Analytics & AI-avdelning
description:
I en snabbt förändrande omvärld med ständigt nya teknologiska framsteg står Uddeholm i framkant inom teknik och innovation som världens ledande verktygsståltillverkare. För att fortsatt stärka vår organisation söker vi nu en Data Engineer som kan bidra till vår Data Analytics & AI-avdelning med sin expertis, och därigenom spela en avgörande roll i att driva vår innovationsresa framåt.

**Din Roll**


Som Data Engineer kommer du att spela en central roll i att utveckla och underhålla den datainfrastruktur som möjliggör effektiv insamling, lagring, bearbetning och analys av data för att stödja organisationens verksamhet. Du kommer att tillhöra gruppen Data Engineering, som är en nyckelkomponent i avdelningen Dataanalys och AI. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:

* **Dataarkitektur och Modellering**: Designa och implementera robusta och skalbara datamodeller och arkitekturer för att möta företagets behov.
* **Datahantering och Integration**: Utveckla och implementera processer för att extrahera, transformera och ladda (ETL) data från olika källor till datalager.
* **Datakvalitet och Säkerhet**: Implementera metoder för att säkerställa datakvalitet och hantera säkerhetsaspekter av data, inklusive åtkomstkontroller.
* **Verktyg och Teknik**: Arbeta med olika datahanteringsverktyg och teknologier, som databasplattformar, big data-ramverk och molnbaserade tjänster.
* **Optimering av Prestanda**: Kontinuerligt övervaka och optimera prestanda för databehandlingsprocesser och queries för att säkerställa snabba svarstider.
* **Dokumentation**: Skapa och upprätthålla dokumentation för datamodeller, ETL-processer och andra relevanta systemkomponenter

**Din Profil**


För att lyckas i denna roll tror vi att du har en akademisk utbildning inom systemutveckling, datorvetenskap eller liknande, alternativt arbetslivserfarenhet i en liknande roll. Du har erfarenhet av funktionell programmering och moderna databasverktyg. Dessutom behärskar du både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


Vi ser det som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med stora datamängder med verktyg som Spark, samt god kunskap om versionshantering genom GitLab eller GitHub. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnlösningar, särskilt Microsoft Azure och har en bakgrund av arbete inom tillverkningsindustri. Det är även fördelaktigt om du behärskar tyska i tal och skrift.

**Personliga Egenskaper**


Vi söker en tekniskt kunnig person som är nyfiken, driven och inte rädd för att testa nya lösningar. Du kommunicerar väl i både tal och skrift och är en prestigelös lagspelare.

**Information och Ansökan**


Vid frågor angående tjänsten ber vi dig att kontakta Erik Hallin, Head of Data Analytics, via email erik.hallin@uddeholm.com. Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-04-15, men urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas tidigare så sök så snart som möjligt. Skicka in din ansökan via länken nedan (vi tar inte emot ansökningar på mail).
