title: Specialist inom servervirtualisering
description:
**IT Avdelningen söker en erfaren specialist inom servervirtualisering som kommer ha en ledande roll i att driva och utveckla vår VMware plattform.** 




  





**Vilka är vi** 




 Sektionen Applikationsinfrastruktur är en del av enheten IT Infrastruktur. Vi som jobbar inom sektionen ansvarar för leveranser inom Windows / Linux / VMware / Mailinfrastruktur och är navet i många av Arbetsförmedlingens leveranser. Här jobbar vi med den senaste tekniken och en ständig utveckling av våra miljöer. Nu förstärker vi vårt team inom VMware med en erfaren specialist inom servervirtualisering.
 



 Vårt mål är högt satt – vi tänker bli Sveriges modernaste myndighet!
 



 Vi kan med stolthet säga att enheten IT Infrastruktur ligger i framkant gällande att anamma ny innovativ teknik. Vi skapar grunden för Arbetsförmedlingens utveckling mot digitalisering, självbetjäning och automatisering samt levererar ett bemötande i världsklass!
 



  





 Det bästa med att jobba inom enheten är att vi medarbetare, genom självledarskap, ges stor möjlighet att vara med och påverka enhetens utveckling. Vi respekterar och lyfter varandra och lär oss genom att prova oss fram. Det är en spännande utmaning att ständigt kunna leverera högklassiga IT-lösningar till våra kunder och medarbetare i en omfattande förändring.
 



 För att vi ska vara framgångsrika och lyckas med vårt uppdrag har vi en stark tro på att leverera iterativt och att lära oss på vägen. Vi har basen i Scrum och inspireras av SAFe-ramverket.
 



  





**Beskrivning av tjänsten** 




 Som specialist inom servervirtualisering kommer du arbeta med drift, förvaltning och incidenthantering av vår omfattande VMware-miljö. Du är aktiv i utvecklingen av plattformen och du driver arbetet mot uppställda mål i nära samarbete med kollegor i teamet likväl som inom övrig IT-infrastruktur, plattformar, utveckling och test. Som en del av Arbetsförmedlingens transformation, där modern teknik är en nyckel, kommer du också få möjlighet att bidra inom områden som containerteknik och automatisering.
 



 I den här tjänsten kommer du att ha rollen som produktägare vilket innebär att du har överblick över teamets leverans och leder teamet i rätt riktning gällande daglig drift och förvaltning men även vidareutveckling inom området. Som produktägare fungerar du som stöd till sektionens produktansvarig.
 



 Arbetet sker i en omfattande teknisk miljö med många systemintegrationer i ett modernt IT-landskap. Här får du vara med och utforma din egen roll, hitta din egen plats och skapa ditt eget bidrag inom organisationen.
 



  





**Vem söker vi** 




 Vi letar efter dig med en stor passion för IT som genom din helhetssyn ser hur man skapar värde i för våra kunder. Du är självgående med förmågan att kunna ta egna initiativ och driva saker självständigt, men du trivs också med att arbeta i grupp och stimuleras av problemlösning. Vi kommer i vår tur att göra allt vi kan för att du ska få en rivstart i din utveckling.
 



  





**Vårt erbjudande** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid som kan komma att inledas med sex månaders provanställning. Placeringsorten är Solna.
 



 Vi erbjuder dig möjligheten att arbeta på en arbetsplats där vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Du får tillgång till ett generöst semesteravtal, flexibla arbetstider samt möjlighet att arbeta på distans upp till 49 procent på årsbasis. Hos oss ingår även friskvård under arbetstid och ett förmånligt friskvårdsbidrag.
 



  





**Grundläggande kvalifikationskrav** 



* Flerårig relevant dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet från de senaste åren av arbete med VMware lösningar i/för större organisationer.
* Djup teknisk kompetens i VMware vSphere och ESXi
* God kännedom om lagring och nätverk i större miljöer
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom Linux och Windows
* Flytande i svenska i tal och skrift



  





**Övriga meriter för tjänsten** 



* Erfarenhet av arbete med Kubernetes
* Erfarenhet av arbete med NetBackup tex: Uppgraderingar och patchning
* Erfarenhet av avancerad Datacenterarkitektur och dess komponenter
* Arbetat i en processdriven organisation. Vi jobbar enligt ITIL ramverket.

title: Portfolio Manager / Business Analyst – Data Product & Strategy (Temporary)
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M  here.
   

  

 We are on a journey to transform ourselves, and elevate H&M Brand. This involves taking a large leap in H&M’s Data and AI capabilities. The steering, development, and management of our Data and AI portfolio, in addition to close collaboration with our business functions and other tech areas, is key to achieving our ambitions targets.
   

  

 Within the Tech Center AI, Analytics & Data (AIAD) and the Data Product & Strategy unit, is the Portfolio Management team. AIAD is dedicated to creating impactful solutions that transform industries and “liberate fashion to the many”. We are looking for a dynamic and experienced Portfolio Manager to join our team and manage our Data and AI product portfolio. The portfolio consists of various teams providing AI applications and Data products to all of H&M Group – employees and customers.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a Portfolio Manager you will be responsible for overseeing the strategic direction, development, and performance of our portfolio of Data and AI-driven products. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, delivering Data & AI solutions, and business functions including product development, marketing, and sales, to ensure the successful delivery and growth of our product offerings.
   

  

 In our Data & AI portfolio we have multiple programs representing our various business functions. The mission of the Portfolio Management team is to “Advance and optimize our portfolio to enable effective and efficient program delivery”.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Hold the company-wide Portfolio Management together.
* Consolidate, report, and monitor initiative progress tracking across the full portfolio (the entirety of our Brand Plan)
* Consolidate delays/risks, roadblocks and dependencies for escalation when needed.
* Secure frameworks, steering and prioritization processes cross-functionally.
* Develop, maintain and provide best practice for governance structure (e.g., meeting forums, cadence)
* Develop, maintain and provide best practice and standardized tools.


**Qualifications**
 To be successful in this role, you will have:
   

  

* 4 years+ work experience with portfolio management, with experience managing a Data & AI portfolio and Data management being highly desirable.
* A proven track record of leading project and large program delivery that drives business results.
* Evidence of delivering business value through effective portfolio management and achieving strategic goals.
* A strategic mind-set and ability to prioritize.
* A collaborative ethos, with excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Fluent in English.


**Additional Information**
**This is a 1 year temporary position based in Liljeholmen, Stockholm** 
 . If you feel that your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your resume in English by April 3rd.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 .
   

  

**Diversity, Inclusion, and Innovation**
 At H&M Group, we're deeply committed to fostering a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We actively seek out qualified candidates regardless of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.
   

  

 Our commitment to an inclusive workplace drives our dynamic and forward-thinking culture. Regardless of your background, origin, or preferences, your application is warmly welcomed. We value diverse perspectives and skills, and every applicant contributes to our vibrant, creative community. Join us and be part of the future we're building.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At H&M Group, you're not just joining a team – you're joining a value-driven culture and an expansive tech network. Enjoy perks like staff discount cards, flexible work arrangements, wellness benefits, parental support, and more. Here, you're encouraged to be yourself, experiment, and chart your own growth path. As you flourish, so do we, with opportunities to create tangible impacts and shape the future.

title: Category Management Lead
description:
**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





 We are happy to invite applications for exciting internship opportunities at TCS. The internship allows you to gain unique and real-life perspectives in solving challenges for TCS and its Customers.
 



  





**Role: Category Management Lead** 




**Experience (Years): 15+ Years** 




**Language requirement: Swedish & English** 




  





**Must-Have:** 




 • Business Process Lead with Strong process knowledge and experience in planning & conducting process workshops and do FIT/GAP analysis in Category management process in S/4 HANA
 



 • Minimum of 15+ years of experience in SAP Retail in Category Management Process Pricing, Assortments, Procure to Pay processes
 



 • S/4 HANA implementation experience is must
 



 • Hand-On with Process modelling tools Signavio preferred, other process modelling tools
 



 • Experience on
 



 • Represent in Process Board & Solution Design authority board on critical Process GAPs / Architecture solution review and decision documentation.
 



 • Ensure Fit to Standard and govern clean core principles with technical architects
 



 • Business process design documentation and coordinate with Process owners for review & ensure Sign-off
 



 • Strong Knowledge on Procure to Pay process – Purchase Order management, EDI Integrations, Invoice management and 3-way match handling, Promotion, Retail Pricing (Cost, transfer & Retail Pricing processes and methods), Assortments Process for external assortments tool integration to S4.
 



 • Experience / Capability knowledge on SAP Open Text VIM Solution is preferred

title: Senior Systemutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

****Jobbeskrivning****
* Självständigt utveckla användargränssnitt från start i React
* Skriva lättförstådd kod med hög kvalitet
* Skriva tester för användargränssnitt
* Ta fram lösningsförslag till användargränsnittet för systemet
* Integrera front-end och tester i systemets built-pipe och dev-ops-rutiner
* Medverka i teamets planeringsaktiviteter
* Delta i förvaltningen av de IT-system som projektet levererar, där användarstöd, felsökning, buggrättning och vidareutveckling ingår samt bistå i övrigt i IT-förvaltningen, kan bli aktuellt längre fram.


**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Högskole/universitetsutbildning 120hp/180hp inom IT, alternativt motsvarande utbildning eller minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet med nedanstående arbetsområden.
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling i Javascript och React.
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling i HTML / CSS
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling i Testutveckling för användargränssnitt
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av agila arbetssätt
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av CI/CD och DevOps, där verktyg som Azure DevOps Server, GitLab eller GitHub har använts


**Meriterande**
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling i Javascript av applikationer som stödjer dataanalys.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet från att ha byggt CI/CD-pipelines i Azure DevOps Server.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet från testautomation.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 24-03-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Head of Cyber Security & Identity
description:
**Vi på Nordic Leisure Travel Group / Ving söker nu till vår avdelning Business IT i Stockholm en Head of Cyber Security & Identity som ska leda arbetet med att utveckla vår Cyber Security förmåga framåt. Vi söker dig som är en erfaren ledare och brinner för säkerhet, identitet, teknisk vision och innovation. Hos oss får du vara del av en IT avdelning som har stort fokus på ständiga förbättringar av våra digitala lösningar.** 
**Om tjänsten**
 Som Head of Cyber Security & Identity kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att forma och implementera vår tekniska säkerhetsvision. Du kommer tillsammans med ditt team att ansvara för att etablera, underhålla och utveckla våra säkerhets strategier och arbetssätt och stötta våra kollegor och verksamhet inom området.
   

  

 Du blir en del av
 **Technology Services** 
 som som fokuserar på att stärka organisationen genom innovativa, pålitliga och effektiva teknologitjänster. Vi strävar efter att tillhandahålla världsklass infrastruktur, robusta plattformar och dedikerat stöd för våra utvecklingsteam och verksamhet. Vårt fokus ligger på att möjliggöra utveckling och drift, säkerställa säkerhet och identitetshantering, samt främja samarbete och över alla team.
   

  

**Vem vi söker** 
**Vi önskar att du uppfyller följande punkter:**
* Dokumenterad flerårig erfarenhet av att leda säkerhetsteam
* Gedigen erfarenhet och förståelse för cybersäkerhetsramverk, identitets- och åtkomshantering samt riskhanteringsprinciper. (exempelvis NIST, ISO 27001)
* Djup teknisk kompetens inom cybersäkerhet, identitetshantering och säkerhetsarkitektur
* Strategiskt mindset kombinerat med operativ excellens
* Förmåga att kommunicera säkerhetsprinciper till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
* Kan omsätta komplexa säkerhetsutmaningar till tydliga, genomförbara strategier
* Högskoleutbildning inom datavetenskap, teknik, matematik eller motsvarande kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.


**Det är meriterande om du även:**
* Professionella certifieringar som CISSP, CISM eller SABSA Chartered Security Architect.
* Erfarenhet av DevSecOps
* Bakgrund inom säker mjukvaruutveckling och agilt arbetsätt


****Vi erbjuder****
 Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i framkanten av tekniken och vara en del av vår spännande resa mot att bli ett ännu mer datadrivet och digitalt företag. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där din expertis kommer att vara avgörande för vår framgång.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö där du får en omväxlande vardag tillsammans med härliga kollegor - vi arbetar i nära samarbete mellan de nordiska länderna för att ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året. Vi har dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning.
   

  

 Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!
   

  

 Ansök nu och var med och forma framtiden för Cyber Security i vår organisation!
   

  

****Övrigt****
 Urval sker löpande, så vi välkomnar din ansökan så snart som möjlig.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en bakgrundskontroll att genomföras.
   

  

**I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs – ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Testerna utgår från vedertagen forskning och ger oss möjlighet att på ett opartiskt sätt bedöma dina styrkor och eventuella utmaningar i relation till aktuell tjänst. Om du uppfyller grundkraven hos oss kommer du att få testerna skickade till dig och även mer information om dessa, men om du är nyfiken redan nu kan du läsa mer om dem hos** 
**Alva Labs** 
**.**
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten kontakta Sami Breinholt
 **(sami.breinholt@nltg.com)** 
 .
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernen Nordic Leisure Travel Group. I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Globetrotter, Ving Norge, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 500 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.
   

  

 Vi är ett företag där vi har roligt och bryr oss om varandra med vårt people promise "it should be fun, developing and rewarding doing a good job".
   

  

 Arbetsområde
   

  

 IT
   

  

 Roll: Technology Services
   

  

 Platser: Stockholm
   

  

 Distansarbete: Hybridarbete
   

  

 Anställningsform: Heltid
   

  

 Startdatum
   

  

 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Kontaktperson: Sami Breinholt (sami.breinholt@nltg.com)

title: Software Engineering Manager
description:
**About us:** 




 Hormona is a data-driven women’s health company, on a mission to revolutionize women’s health. Our award-winning app is the first comprehensive personalized hormone tracking app that helps women of all ages understand and optimize their individual cycle and hormone health. Through a wide range of popular features such as hormone, cycle, period, and symptom tracking, daily health insights, hormone education, dietary advice, and symptom-mitigating tips and plans, Hormona is pioneering the area of "Hormone Health" and cycle optimization.
 



  





**Who we’re looking for:** 




 We’re on the lookout for a passionate, forward-thinking technology leader to join our mission to revolutionize women’s health. As the Software Engineering Manager, you will drive the strategic direction for our technology infrastructure and data components, enabling us to scale and innovate while optimizing the product experience. You thrive on solving complex problems and can seamlessly blend technical expertise with strategic thinking. With a strong foundation in engineering, data and technology, you’re someone who can take our platform to the next level, transforming data into actionable insights and ensuring robust technology solutions that support our growth. If you’re excited by the opportunity to lead technology initiatives that directly impact women’s health, this is the perfect role for you.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 As the Software Engineering Manager you will lead and manage the technology and data strategy for Hormona. You will be responsible for overseeing the development and optimization of our tech stack, ensuring that it supports our product vision and user experience. You’ll play a crucial role in harnessing the power of data to drive informed decisions, improve user engagement, and contribute to product innovation. You’ll be working with a modern tech stack - with NestJs (Typescript), React Native (Expo), GCP & postgreSQL. This role is very hands on and also involves hiring, growing and leading the tech te
 



 You will manage the engineering and data team while collaborating closely with cross-functional teams including product management, marketing and sales to ensure that Hormona's technology and products are scalable, secure, and high-performing. Additionally, you will oversee data policies and governance, ensuring that data collection, analysis, and usage align with the highest standards for privacy, security, and accuracy.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Technology Strategy & Leadership** 
 : Define and lead the technology strategy to ensure scalability, security, and performance of Hormona’s tech stack, while actively contributing to its implementation and development.
* **Hands-On Development** 
 : Write, review, and optimize code for critical components of the platform, ensuring high-quality, efficient, and maintainable software solutions.
* **Build and Maintain Infrastructure** 
 : Design, implement, and maintain the app's backend systems, APIs, and database architecture to support real-time analytics, personalization, and seamless user experiences.
* **Data-Driven Decision Making** 
 : Leverage data insights to inform business decisions, working directly with data pipelines and analytics tools to enable real-time insights and reporting.
* **Collaboration Across Teams** 
 : Work closely with the product, engineering, marketing, and data science teams to ensure seamless integration of technology solutions and data insights into the user experience.
* **Security & Compliance** 
 : Implement best practices for data security, privacy, and compliance with regulations such as HIPAA and GDPR, while coding robust security measures into the platform.
* **Data Governance** 
 : Establish data governance best practices, ensuring that data is accurate, reliable, and used responsibly across all teams.
* **Performance Optimization** 
 : Continuously monitor, debug, and improve system performance to ensure a fast and reliable experience for users.
* **Drive Technology Innovation** 
 : Stay ahead of industry trends, emerging technologies and frameworks, adopting and integrating them as necessary to keep the platform cutting-edge.
* **Mentor and Guide Team Members** 
 : Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior developers, fostering a culture of learning and collaboration.
* **User Conversion Enablement** 
 : Collaborate with product and marketing teams to leverage data insights for optimizing user funnels and improving conversion rates from free to paid users.
* **Data Infrastructure Management** 
 : Build and maintain robust data pipelines, storage, and processing systems that enable effective use of analytics and machine learning for personalization and product improvements.
* **Ownership of Deliverables** 
 : Take full ownership of technical deliverables, ensuring they are delivered on time and align with strategic goals.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Proven experience (5+ years) in leading technology and data teams, ideally within the health or wellness industry, with a focus on mobile applications and data analytics.
* 5+years of experience working with NestJs (Typescript), React Native (Expo), GCP & postgreSQL
* Strong expertise in managing data infrastructure, including data storage, analytics, and reporting tools (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, SQL, BigQuery, etc.).
* Experience in utilizing data to drive decision-making, improve user engagement, and enhance product performance.
* Familiarity with health data compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR) and experience managing secure data operations.
* Expertise in implementing data analytics and machine learning models to personalize user experiences and optimize business outcomes.
* Experience in scaling technology platforms and ensuring they meet growing user demands and product innovations.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams and ensure alignment across business units.
* A data-driven mindset with the ability to extract actionable insights from complex datasets and communicate them clearly to stakeholders.
* Ability to think strategically while maintaining a focus on practical execution, particularly in fast-paced environments.



  





**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* Experience in SaaS, subscription-based, or mobile app business models.
* Familiarity with women’s health trends, challenges, and opportunities in the digital health space.
* Advanced degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Experience with A/B testing, experimentation frameworks, and optimization of user flows and conversion points.
* Experience with Imagine processing reading and AI.



  





**What we offer you** 




 😊 A friendly, curious, and international working environment with a small, ambitious team
 



 ⏰ Flexible working opportunities
 



 🤝 Impact the future of the company
 



 💼 Office space in Stockholm
 



 🌎 Fun meet-ups with the whole team around Europe
 



 ⭐️ Play a big role in our mission to improve the future of female health
 



 🌱 Growth opportunities
 



 💰 Competitive salary with the opportunity for options
 



  





 As the Software Engineering Manager at Hormona, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of technology use in women’s health, driving innovations that empower women to take control of their well-being. If you are a strategic, tech-driven leader who thrives in an environment where data and technology intersect with wellness, this role is for you. Join us in making a profound impact on women’s health through cutting-edge technology and data-driven insights.

title: ServiceNow Architect - Nordic Speaking
company_industry: Staffing and Recruiting and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
We’re looking for a visionary Senior ServiceNow Architect! Lead the design of cutting-edge, scalable solutions and drive strategic innovation for our clients. If you have a passion for excellence and a track record of success, join us and shape the future of ServiceNow.
 



  




* Advanced ServiceNow Platform Knowledge: Mastery of ServiceNow architecture, including ITSM, ITOM, and ITBM modules.
* Strategic Design Skills: Ability to design scalable, robust, and future-proof ServiceNow solutions.
* Integration Expertise: Proficiency in integrating ServiceNow with other systems and third-party applications.
* Technical Governance: Experience in managing technical governance and ensuring best practices.
* Certifications: Holding advanced ServiceNow certifications such as Certified Technical Architect (CTA) or Certified Master Architect (CMA).



  





 This is a Permanent position for people based in the Nordics with any fluent Nordic Language skills

title: ServiceNow Analyst/Architect/Developer
description:
ServiceNow Analyst/Architect/Developer
 



  





 Whitehall Resources are currently looking for 3 ServiceNow resources within Business Analysis, Architecture and Developer onsite in Sweden for an initial 6 month contract.
 



  





**Role 1 - ServiceNow Business Analyst** 




  





 In the role of ServiceNow business analyst with a focus on CSM/HRSD, Business Process Management and digital process automation, you will lead workshops and define technical and functional business requirements. You will structure, follow up and ensure that requirements are met and create value for the business. The role also means being an important support for the business and contributing to the customer achieving their business goals during the transformation journey.
 



  





 In addition, you act as the bridge between IT and business, and through dialogue and communication you capture and document the business needs, which creates the conditions for ServiceNow solutions adapted to the customer's needs, while contributing to business development.
 



  





**Key Skills:** 



* At least 5 years of experience with ServiceNow, Business Process Management within ServiceNow and process automation.
* At least 10 years of experience as a Business Analyst.
* Relevant ServiceNow certifications such as CSM or HRSD. Additional certifications within the ServiceNow suite are a plus.
* Experience in business development.
* CSA or CIS certification.
* Experience with agile working methods and SAFe certification is a plus.
* Good knowledge of Swedish and English.



  





  





**Role 2 - ServiceNow Architect** 




  





 In the role of ServiceNow Architect with a focus on CSM/HRSD, Business Process Management and Digital Process Automation. You will have a central role in designing and developing modern solutions that optimize processes and workflows, while contributing to business development.
 



 You will be responsible for defining and driving the overall strategy of the ServiceNow platform with our customers. Working closely with your product teams ensures that they have the right conditions to succeed. The role also involves providing strategic advice and guidance on the platform and supporting Business Analysts with solution proposals and estimates.
 



 In addition, you will be a key person in optimizing the use of ServiceNow by proactively leading the work of implementing technical and cost-effective solutions. It is expected that you can act as a mentor and help and support junior consultants to grow in the ServiceNow area.
 



  





**Key Skills:** 



* At least 4 years of experience in ServiceNow/ServiceNow architecture, have experience in Business Process Management and process automation.
* At least 7 years of experience as an Architect or Tech Lead.
* Relevant ServiceNow certifications such as CSM or HRSD. Additional certifications within the ServiceNow suite are a plus.
* CSA or CIS certification.
* Several years of experience in designing, developing, testing, implementing and maintaining the ServiceNow platform and its integrations.
* Experience of agile working methods and SAFe certification is an advantage.
* Experience in technical consulting and management.
* Experience in business development.
* Experience in planning and implementing ServiceNow upgrades.
* Good if you have experience with Multi Service Provider (MSP) solutions based on ServiceNow.
* Experience in pre-sales activities as well as responding to RFPs and RFIs.
* Good knowledge of Swedish and English.



  





  





**Role 3 - ServiceNow Developer** 




  





**Job Duties** 



* Configure workflows in the CSM module and ITSM module
* Provide technical advice for platform and application and interpret requirements to estimate time/cost to implement development.
* Ensure that the platform maintains the strict security requirements set within the authority and maintains associated design specifications and documentation
* Conduct platform administration and development according to 'Best Practices' from ServiceNow and support change and management activities within the platform and application
* Design, development, configuration and adaptations of ServiceNow applications and services
* Participate in planning, developing and implementing IT solutions based on business needs
* Support with ongoing management tasks and maintenance
* Application maintenance, performance monitoring and error identification and remediation
* Verification/Validation of new and existing functionality
* Support with deployment
* Support with application upgrades
* Develop and be responsible for design, installation, operation, system documentation, manuals and walkthroughs
* Responsible for skills transfer and training of personnel at SFE
* Environmental monitoring ServiceNow



  





**Key Skills:** 



* The consultant must have Competence and work experience corresponding to competence level 4
* At least 3 years of documented experience as a ServiceNow developer within CSM/ITSM
* At least 3 years of documented experience within JavaScript, HTML, CSS
* At least 3 years of documented work on configuration and customizations

title: Solutions Consultant, Stockholm
description:
We are looking for a new Solutions Consulting team member in Stockholm to help accelerate our exciting journey ahead! As a member of this team, you will have the opportunity to become a trusted advisor and help world-class marketers gather, analyze, and optimize their data with Funnel.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Your main responsibilities include working as a sales engineer to demonstrate the value of Funnel to prospects and customers. This includes supporting them during their assessment period from a technical standpoint while sharing best practices related to gathering/managing/analyzing marketing data, especially within the context of addressing complex use cases.
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with our Account Executives and Customer Success Managers as well as our Product teams to provide input on the evolution of the Funnel product.
   

  

 You will have achieved success when the prospect or customer fully understands how Funnel is foundational to helping them achieve their business goals as well as helping ongoing customers grow their business with Funnel.
   

  

**As a Solutions Consultant You Will**
* Lead technical pre-sales conversations with prospects
* Lead the implementation of Funnel as a first milestone of the Funnel journey
* Work with customers on complex marketing data use cases
* Become an expert in using the Funnel platform
* Provide input to the Product teams to make our solution even better and deliver ever-increasing value to our customers.
* Collaborate with other members of the global Solutions Consulting team on global initiatives.
* You will join the EMEA team with colleagues based in Stockholm, Dublin and London.


 If you'd like to learn more about Corinna, the Manager of the Solutions Consulting team in EMEA, and her views on leadership, check out this blog post.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a solutions-oriented, proactive product and customer evangelist with outstanding communication skills.
   

  

 You are curious, eager to learn, a team player, and seek out opportunities to help others.
   

  

 You thrive in a consultative environment where you feel comfortable being an expert and knowing how to guide, educate, and manage clear expectations of customers.
   

  

 You are detail-oriented and enjoy working with data. Going down the rabbit hole to get a deep understanding of a problem and how to solve it is something that appeals greatly to you!
   

  

**Experience & Skills**
* Around 2-4 years of experience in a solution consulting, implementation or pre-sales engineering role
* Domain knowledge of digital platforms and/or experience in working with data, marketing analytics, or performance marketing reporting
* Experience in and enjoy working in a client-facing role
* Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, Looker Studio or similar applications
* Fluency in spoken and written English and German


**Who We Are**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting. Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

**Other Information**
 This role is located in our Stockholm office. At Funnel, we highly value in-person collaboration and we have an office-first approach. We work from the office a minimum of four days a week while still allowing plenty of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer months, and holidays.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Business Analyst
job_function: Analyst, Business Development, and Information Technology
company_industry: Strategic Management Services, Motor Vehicle Manufacturing, and Financial Services
description:
**Business Analyst inom Digital & Sales Development** 




 Ta chansen att vara med och driva den digitala förändringsresan hos oss – sök nu!
 



  





**Vill du vara en nyckelspelare i en av bilbranschens största digitala transformationsresor? Vill du arbeta med några av världens mest ikoniska varumärken – Volkswagen, Audi, Skoda, Seat och Cupra – och driva utvecklingen av datadriven försäljning och digitala lösningar? Då är detta rollen för dig!** 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Volkswagen Group Sverige är på en förändringsresa mot framtiden där vi nyligen startat upp ett nytt affärsområde kallat Digital & Sales Development. Till det nya affärsområdet söker vi nu en Business Analyst. I rollen kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i att driva våra digitala initiativ och försäljningsstrategier framåt.
 



  





 I denna nyckelroll kommer du att samarbeta med olika affärsenheter såsom marknads- och säljavdelningar samt IT, för att säkerställa att våra digitala lösningar och strategier baseras på data, avancerad analys och den senaste tekniken. Du kommer att arbeta i framkant av ny teknik, med fokus på AI, automation och avancerad analys, för att optimera försäljningsprocesser och skapa nya affärsmöjligheter.
 



  





 Detta är en helt ny roll på VGS, vilket innebär att du har stora möjligheter att påverka, forma din vardag och bidra till att driva den digitala transformationen inom några av bilbranschens starkaste varumärken.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter är** 



* **Driva digital transformation:** 
 VGS är på en förändringsresa med ett stort datadrivet fokus. Du kommer spela en avgörande roll i detta arbete och med stor påverkansgrad guida och utbilda vår verksamhet mot VGS strategiska mål.
* **Datadriven affärsutveckling:** 
 Identifiera områden som lämpar sig för AI och avancerad analys för att skapa affärsvärde och effektivisering men också reflektera över befintliga processer och hitta nya möjligheter.
* **Utveckla och förbättra rapporteringslandskapet:** 
 Arbeta med BI-verktyg, dataplattformar och analysmodeller för att skapa effektiva och relevanta beslutsunderlag.
* **Behovsanalys & kravhantering:** 
 Djupdyka i verksamhetens behov och med tydligt VGS-fokus paketera dessa mot VGS utvecklingsteam. Du kommer tillsammans med PM för BI och Analytics arbeta med prioriteringar för att hela tiden generera hög ratio mellan affärsvärde och nedlagda resurser.
* **Kommunikation, & samarbete:** 
 Fungera som en viktig länk mellan verksamheten och tekniska team, men även tätt samarbete med Business Analysts från andra värdeströmmar för att hantera beroenden och överlapp av inkomna behov.



  





**Vad vi söker** 




 Vi söker dig med minst 5-7 års erfarenhet inom affärsanalys, BI eller CRM. Har du tidigare genomgått en digital förändringsresa är det ett stort plus! För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har en skarp förmåga att analysera och optimera affärsprocesser. Kreativitet och nytänkande är egenskaper du besitter för att hitta rätt synergier i data och driva försäljningen framåt.
 



 Du har en stark kommunikativ förmåga och är skicklig på att översätta affärsbehov till utvecklingskrav och försäljningsstrategier. Vi tror även att du är strukturerad och noggrann, och trivs med att samarbeta med olika affärsenheter och intressenter för att driva förändring och skapa värde.
 



  





 Erfarenhet av BI-verktyg som Power BI, Tableau eller Qlik är meriterande, liksom en grundläggande förståelse för SQL och datamodellering.
 



  





 En god förståelse för hur data kan struktureras och analyseras för att skapa insikter och stödja beslutsfattande är en stor fördel liksom erfarenhet av att arbeta med kravställning mot dataplattformar, molnlösningar eller integrationslösningar.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 



* **Spännande utmaningar och digitala projekt:** 
 En unik möjlighet att vara med och forma ett helt nytt affärsområde inom bilbranschen, där data och digital innovation driver förändring.
* **Starka utvecklingsmöjligheter:** 
 Stora chanser att växa och utvecklas i en organisation som satsar helhjärtat på digitala lösningar och innovation– vi ser din potential och vill ge dig utrymme att ta nästa steg.
* **Strategiskt inflytande & möjlighet att göra skillnad**
* I denna roll får du en nyckelposition i vår digitala transformation, där du är med och formar både arbetssätt, datadrivna lösningar och framtida affärsstrategier.
* **Flexibel arbetsmiljö:** 
 Moderna arbetsförhållanden där du har möjlighet att påverka din egen arbetsmiljö och arbetsdag.
* **Konkurrenskraftiga förmåner:** 
 Vi erbjuder attraktiva förmåner som gör vardagen lite enklare och roligare.



  





**Vill du vara med på resan?** 




 Detta är en unik möjlighet att bli en del av en av bilbranschens mest spännande digitala förändringsresor. Hos Volkswagen Group Sverige får du chansen att arbeta med marknadsledande varumärken, driva digital innovation och påverka framtidens försäljning.
 



 Vi letar efter dig som vill vara med och skapa förändring – är du den vi söker?
 



 Ansök nu och bli en del av vårt team!
 



  





**Ansökan och kontakt** 




 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att ringa rekryterande chef
 *Douglas Sjöholm, Head of Group Sales & Agency Steering* 
 på
 



 tel. 08-120 810 61
 



  





**Kontaktuppgifter till fackliga representanter:** 




 Annika Saarenpää Ordf. Unionen, tel: 08-553 868 89
 



 Kristian Jansson Ordf. Ledarna, tel: 08-588 348 31
 



 Du är välkommen att skicka din ansökan bestående av CV. Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande.
 



  





**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-13** 




*Volkswagen Group Sverige AB är Sveriges största bilimportör och är ett helägt dotterbolag till Europas största bilproducent Volkswagen AG. Vi marknadsför Volkswagen Personbilar, Audi, SEAT, CUPRA, ŠKODA, Porsche och Volkswagen Transportbilar – samtliga med starkt fäste på den svenska marknaden. I företagsgruppen ingår även dotterbolaget Europeisk Biluthyrning AB.* 




 Läs mer om oss som arbetsgivare och om vår värdegrund på vår
 **karriärsida.**

title: M365 Architect
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 Ericsson is a global leader in telecommunications and technology, driving innovation and connectivity worldwide. We are committed to creating a sustainable future through cutting-edge solutions and services.
   

  

 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Microsoft 365 architect to join our team at Ericsson. As a Microsoft 365 architect, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and optimizing our Microsoft 365 environment, which is pivotal for enhancing our collaborative capabilities and driving organizational productivity. This platform is integral to our digital transformation strategy, enabling seamless communication, efficient document management, and robust security measures across the company. You will work closely with product owners, DevOps teams, and business partners to reach our business objectives.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Create integration design patterns and principles and collaborate with solution architects.
* Guide development and integration teams to ensure successful implementation.
* Collaborate with subject matter experts and business partners to understand business processes and capabilities.
* Drive compliance with security and architecture requirements.
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to team members.


**The Skills You Bring**
 Key Competencies:
   

  

* Deep technical understanding of the Microsoft collaboration stack within Office 365, SharePoint Online, Exchange and Teams.
* Proven experience in building and running integrations.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to convert strategy into action.
* Passion for working together and solving complex problems in a team environment.
* Strong stakeholder and end-user orientation.
* Extensive engineering and architecture experience with large-scale Microsoft Office 365 deployments.
* Knowledge of cloud technologies, including SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS solutions.
* Experience with PowerShell, PowerShell Workflow, and troubleshooting PowerShell ISE.
* Knowledge of IT security standards and risks, including Identity Management (Active Directory, Entra ID).


 Qualifications & Experience Requirements:
   

  

* Degree in Engineering, IT, or a related field.
* 6+ years of IT Architecture experience.
* 3+ years of Microsoft 365 Architecture experience.


**Application**
 We look forward to your application with CV/Resume in English.
   

  

 Last day to apply: 3rd of April 2025
   

  

 Location: Bangalore, India or Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Flexibility of work: We target 60% attendance at office.
   

  

 Please note that we do not accept, process, or respond to applications sent via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Nina Juthage, Principal Talent Acquisition Partner, at nina.a.juthage@ericsson.com
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.
   

  

 If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com
   

  

 DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees in this position. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position, and you may be required to perform additional job tasks as assigned.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Job details:** 
 IT Technology Specialist
   

  

 ]]>

title: Northridge söker erfarna konsulter inom teknisk projektledning
description:
**Northridge söker erfarna konsulter inom teknisk projektledning** 




 Trivs du med att leda, planera, organisera och genomföra tekniska projekt i samarbete med kunder? Då kan konsultrollen som teknisk projektledare hos oss på Northridge vara intressant.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som teknisk projektledare hos Northridge ansvarar du för att driva framgångsrika projekt genom teknisk expertis, tydlig kommunikation och engagerat ledarskap. Du lyssnar in behov, sätter upp mål, säkerställer uppföljning och navigerar komplexa projekt. Med fokus på kvalitet levererar du lösningar som uppfyller både tekniska krav och affärsmässiga mål. Våra uppdrag innebär ofta följande ansvarsområden och uppgifter:
 



  




* Ansvara för att definiera behov, driva projekt, säkerställa tekniska krav och leverera lösningar.
* Säkerställa att projektet följer budget och håller sig inom sin tidsplan.
* Leda gruppen, motivera projektmedlemmar och samordna mellan leverantörer.
* Skapa affärs- och kundvärde som bidrar till att målen uppfylls på ett professionellt sätt.



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker dig som är erfaren teknisk projektledare och har haft ledande roller i olika IT-organisationer och projekt. Med din ledarskapsförmåga engagerar du dina projektmedlemmar och når målen. Du är intresserad av teknik, har troligen tidigare jobbat med programmering och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad inom nya trender. Du drivs av att leverera med hög kvalitet och delar våra värderingar och ledord vad gäller professionalism och engagemang.
 



  





**För att passa i rollen som Teknisk projektledare tror vi att du har följande bakgrund:** 




 ·       Flera års erfarenhet som teknisk projektledare.
 



 ·       Erfarenhet av att leda komplexa IT-projekt och agila team.
 



 ·       God kunskap om projektstyrningsmodeller och agila metoder (t.ex. Scrum, Kanban).
 



 ·       Stark teknisk förståelse och förmåga att samarbeta med tekniska specialister.
 



 ·       Erfarenhet av att arbeta som konsult och vilja fortsätta i konsultrollen på lång sikt.
 



 ·       Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både tal och skrift.
 



 ·       Gärna bakgrund inom programmering med en nyfikenhet och intresse för att hålla sig uppdaterad inom programmering, teknik och AI.
 



 ·       Examen inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Northridge är ett mindre konsultbolag för erfarna konsulter där din kompetens gör verklig skillnad. Vår företagskultur genomsyras av en stark entreprenörsanda där du har stora möjligheter att påverka din egen och företagets utveckling. Vi värdesätter vår gemenskap och familjära stämning högt. På Northridge lägger vi stort fokus på kompetensutveckling genom intressanta uppdrag, utbildningar och konferenser. Våra kunder finns inom flertalet olika branscher.
 



  





**Vad Northridge erbjuder** 




 Northridge erbjuder en möjlighet att vara med på resan av ett bolag som växer där dina idéer och kompetens värdesätts högt. Du får vara del av ett härligt gäng som har en inkluderande och samarbetsvänlig arbetsmiljö. Dessutom erbjuder Northridge ett flertal attraktiva och flexibla förmåner för våra konsulter. Lockas du av fördelarna med ett mindre konsultbolag och vill veta mer vad Northridge kan erbjuda, är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till oss.
 



  





**Ansökningsprocessen** 




 Vi hanterar ansökningar, intervjuer och urval löpande vilket innebär att tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Ditt driv, intresse och engagemang är viktigast för oss, så sök gärna även om du inte uppfyller alla önskvärda krav och ta chansen att bli en del av Northridge redan idag.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Nordics Power & Grid Team Manager
description:
**Nordics Power & Grid Team Manager**





 Are you passionate about leading projects and driving customer satisfaction? Schneider Electric is seeking a dedicated Power & Grid Team Manager to join our vibrant team in the Digital Power Application Center (DPAC) Nordics.
 

 Your preferred location will be in Stockholm, Sweden
 

 .
 






**Your Mission:**





 In this pivotal role, you will lead the delivery of high-quality automation, monitoring, and control projects with our SCADA solutions. You will manage a multicultural team, ensuring exceptional project execution, customer communication, overseeing project performance, and driving transformation initiatives for enhanced software, services, and sustainability. Additionally, you will collaborate with the Tender Management team to ensure alignment with our business strategy and growth plans. Your leadership will be key to our success and ambitious goals.
 




**Key Responsibilities:**



* Lead and develop the organization to ensure competitive bid estimates and quotations with a customer-driven mindset.
* Continue to build and grow a high-performance, world-class execution organization that contributes significantly to our Digital Power business.
* Support the Project Management team to ensure successful execution.
* Foster a culture of customer focus and quality within the team.
* Build and lead a diverse team, preparing for the future by identifying critical talent.



**What will help you succeed in this role?**



* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in electrical, Energy, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field.
* Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience.
* Previous experience in managing people.
* Knowledge of key technologies such as Automation and Protection Systems, SCADA, RTUs, IEDs, and mission-critical communication systems is a plus.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Demonstrated teamwork and problem-solving skills.
* Proficiency in both written and spoken English. Other European languages are a plus.




  
 




**What do we offer you?**





  
 





 At Schneider Electric, we are committed to fostering a vibrant and inclusive work culture where every employee is empowered to thrive. As part of our team, you can expect:
 



* **Professional Growth:**

 Access to continuous learning opportunities, mentorship programs, and career development resources to nurture your potential and drive your career forward.
* **Innovative Environment:**


 Be part of a dynamic, forward-thinking organization that encourages creativity, innovation, and entrepreneurial spirit as we lead the way in digital transformation and sustainability.
* **Work-Life Balance:**



 We value your well-being and offer flexible work arrangements, comprehensive wellness programs, and support to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance.
* **Global Impact:**



 Contribute to meaningful projects that address global energy challenges and sustainability, making a positive impact on the world while advancing your career.
* **Inclusive Community:**



 Join a diverse and inclusive community where your unique perspectives are celebrated, and your voice is heard, fostering an environment of collaboration, and belonging.



  
 




  
 
**Did we get you inspired?**





 Join Schneider Electric and unlock your full potential! Apply now and embark on an exciting career journey with us. Please submit your application soonest. We will fill the position as soon as a suitable candidate has been found.
 





  
 










  
 




**Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?**






 When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our  IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.
 





 IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.
 





 We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.
 





 Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!
 





 €36 billion global revenue
   



 +13% organic growth
   



 150 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   



 #1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations
 




  
 







  
 




 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.
 




  
 




*Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do.* 





  
 




*At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here*





*Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.*

title: Senior Data Consultant & People Manager
description:
Are you ready to take your career to the next level? We’re seeking our next People Manager for the Engagement and Advisory unit—a role that combines leadership and hands-on work as a Data professional consultant.
   

  

 As a People Manager, you will build and lead a team of 5-10 consultants, focusing on coaching, career development, and creating a positive work environment. We believe in empowering our managers to prioritize people and clients over administrative tasks.
   

  

 At Capgemini Insights & Data, you will develop both business and technical skills in a supportive work environment that values community and team spirit.
   

  

**What You’ll Do As a People Manager**
* Lead by Example: Be the go-to person for our employees, providing guidance and support.
* Individual Growth & well-being: Conduct regular 1-on-1s, helping consultants plan their careers and achieve their goals. You will foster engagement and well-being within your team.
* Balancing Act & Self-leadership: While supporting your team, maintain your own client-oriented work. Utilization and business development are key.


 In your day-to-day work, you will be contributing as a Senior Data consultant, wearing different hats depending on the context. But your role and responsibilities are at all times related to Advisory, Project & Engagement Management.
   

  

**What You’ll Do as a Consultant:**
* Depending on your role you will work close with our clients and drive initiatives involving data warehouses, analytics, AI, MDM, and strategy development at customer sites.


**YOUR PROFILE**
* You are an experienced data professional within the Data, AI & Analytics field, for example as a delivery manager, business analyst, project manager, program manager or engagement manager.
* You are driven by creating effective teams and contributing by giving the team members the best possible conditions to achieve smart solutions.
* Fluent Swedish skills


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
 We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.  At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities. Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies such as Databricks and Microsoft Azure or focus on strengthening your leadership skills.
   

  

**APPLICATION**
 Ready to join our team? Apply Now!
   

  

**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating a tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com**

title: Engineering Team Lead, Merchant Payouts
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We have an exciting opportunity for an engineering team lead to join our ranks building a bigger and better Wolt. We’re currently on the lookout for an Engineering Team Lead, to join our Merchant Payouts team.
   

  

 The Fintech group as a whole consists of 12 different teams, building financial services used by our Couriers, Merchants and Customers. Those financial services cover a wide range of functionalities, including various payment methods, Invoicing, Anti-Money Laundering processes, Payouts, Cash advances and User Interfaces for a varying group of users who manage all things finance.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As an Engineering Team Lead, you’ll ensure we do the right things in the right way, acting as a facilitator and striving to make the complex things simple. You’ll see it as your biggest mission to cultivate personal growth of your team members and serve as a servant leader by truly getting to know each team member, having regular 1on1s with feedback, and facilitating goal-setting.
   

  

 You’ll also act as an enabler for the daily and weekly practices and do whatever is needed to help the team succeed. As we work in a highly ownership-driven environment, it will often mean taking a step back and giving autonomy to the team, engaging with stakeholders and partners; on other occasions, you may contribute hands-on if you want and give your guidance
   

  

 You ensure world class engineering practices and raise ambition level while working in a sustainable way in a psychologically safe environment. We’d expect you to know well when to apply which approach.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
* You know what it takes to develop top-quality software, take care of people and achieve ambitious goals together.
* You come with previous experience in a highly regulated environment, preferably within the FinTech domain.
* You'll be an inspirer, facilitator and enabler for the team to do what they do best by making personal development plans, hosting regular 1on1s and taking part in recruitment.
* You're not afraid to step into action when needed, and most of the time, you are also ready to step back and let the team do its magic.
* We expect you to be a good communicator, willing to serve people outside of your team and liaise with senior stakeholders.
* You’re a product-oriented and proactive problem solver willing to bring up issues in a constructive manner to the team and the whole Wolt Product team.
* The essential tasks in this role are facilitation, communication, helping high performing engineers to focus and bringing them context. But if you are one of those unicorns with leadership abilities & development skills, there could be room for hands-on contribution as well!
* Our teams work with e.g. Kotlin, Go, TypeScript, React, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Kafka, GitHub Actions, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, DataDog, Looker so we also value skills with any of these.


 Notice to Applicants for Jobs Located in NYC or Remote Jobs Associated With Office in NYC Only
   

  

 We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional process for jobs in NYC and certain features may qualify it as an AEDT in NYC. As part of the hiring and/or promotion process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate submitted applications. We began using Covey Scout for Inbound from August 21, 2023, through December 21, 2023, and resumed using Covey Scout for Inbound again on June 29, 2024.
   

  

 The Covey tool has been reviewed by an independent auditor. Results of the audit may be viewed here: Covey
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Finance Process Lead
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Non-profit Organizations, and Computer and Network Security
description:
**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





 We are happy to invite applications for exciting internship opportunities at TCS. The internship allows you to gain unique and real-life perspectives in solving challenges for TCS and its Customers.
 



  





**Role: Finance Process Lead** 




**Experience (Years): 15+ Years** 




**Language requirement: Swedish & English** 




  





**Must-Have:** 




 • Business Process Lead with Strong process knowledge and experience in planning & conducting process workshops and do FIT/GAP analysis in Finance Processes
 



 • Minimum of 15+ years of experience in SAP FICO Modules
 



 • Experienced in implementing FICO modules, S/4 HANA Implementation experience required
 



 • Hand-On with Process modelling tools Signavio preferred, other process modelling tools
 



 • Experience on
 



 • Represent in Process Board & Solution Design authority board on critical Process GAPs / Architecture solution review and decision documentation.
 



 • Ensure Fit to Standard and govern clean core principles with technical architects
 



 • Business process design documentation and coordinate with Process owners for review & ensure Sign-off
 



 • Strong Knowledge on Material Ledger, Universal ledger, GL, AP, AR, CO-PA, Process integration with other Procure to Pay, Order to cash process is required.
 



 • Experience / Capability knowledge on SAP Open Text VIM Solution is preferred
 



 • Hands on experience on Configuration in system is preferred

 • Understanding of role-based process design and Fiori role design coordination with Roles & Authorization team is required

 • Good communication skills, problem solving mindset and cross functional coordination skills required

title: Hybrid Cloud Statutory Expert
job_function: Business Development, Customer Service, and Consulting
company_industry: Computer and Network Security and Education Administration Programs
description:
**Tata Consultancy Services (TCS)** 
 is a global leader in IT services, digital, and business solutions that partners with its clients to simplify, strengthen and transform their businesses. We ensure the highest levels of certainty and satisfaction through a deep-set commitment to our clients, comprehensive industry expertise, and a global network of innovation and delivery centers. For more information, visit us at www.tcs.com.
 



  





**Job title:** 
 Hybrid Cloud Statutory Expert
 



**Location:** 
 Sweden
 



**Language requirement:** 
 Swedish & English
 



**Experience Range:** 
 15 to 20 years
 



  





**Key responsibilities:** 




  





 Compliance Strategy & Framework:
 


* Develop and implement industry and country specific compliance frameworks for hybrid cloud environments
* Ensure alignment with global regulatory standards, such as GDPR, HIPAA, PCI-DSS, SOX, FedRAMP, and others
* Monitor changes in industry and country specific regulations and update policies accordingly



  





 Risk Management & Audits:
 


* Identify compliance risks associated with hybrid cloud deployments and recommend mitigation strategies
* Conduct regular audits of hybrid cloud systems to ensure adherence to industry and country specific statutory requirements
* Collaborate with internal and external auditors during compliance reviews



  





 Policy Development & Implementation:
 


* Define and enforce data protection policies across hybrid cloud platforms
* Implement security controls to safeguard sensitive information in public and private clouds
* Establish governance models for access management, data residency, and encryption



  





 Collaboration & Training:
 


* Work closely with legal, IT security, and operations teams to address compliance gaps
* Train cross-functional teams on compliance best practices for hybrid cloud environments
* Serve as the primary point of contact for regulatory bodies during inquiries or inspections



  





 Continuous Improvement:
 


* Leverage automation tools to streamline compliance processes (e.g., monitoring, reporting)
* Stay updated on emerging technologies to enhance compliance capabilities in hybrid cloud ecosystems



  





**Mandatory Skill set:** 




  





 Domain Skills:
 


* Proven Expertise in statutory compliance requirements for specific industry verticals (e.g., BFSI/Healthcare/Manufacturing/LSHC etc) and regions (US/UK/EU etc.)
* In-depth knowledge of global regulatory frameworks (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA)
* Deep understanding of cloud security frameworks and compliance standards
* Proficiency in audit tools and compliance management platforms
* Strong analytical skills for risk assessment and mitigation planning



  





 Collaboration Skills:
 


* Strong collaboration skills for cross-functional collaboration



  





 Communication Skills:
 


* Excellent communication abilities to engage effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to articulate statutory and compliance concepts



  





**Desirable skill set:** 



* Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)
* Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)
* Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP)
* Certifications specific to cloud platforms (e.g., AWS Security Specialty, Azure Compliance).
