* Your journey with us isn't limited by boundaries; it's propelled by your aspirations. Join us at BAT and become a part of an environment that thrives on internal advancement, where your career progression isn't just a statement – it's a reality we're eager to build together. Seize the opportunity and own your development; your next chapter starts here.
* You'll have access to online learning platforms and personalized growth programs to nurture your leadership skills
* We prioritise continuous improvement within a transformative environment, preparing for ongoing changes


**WHY JOIN BAT?
   

  

 We’re one of the few companies named as a Global Top Employer by the Top Employers Institute – certified in offering excellent employee conditions.
   

  

 Collaboration, inclusion and partnership underpin everything we do here at BAT. We are looking forward to enabling every individual to thrive, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, skills, experience, education, socio-economic and professional background, veteran status, perspectives and thinking styles. We know that embracing talent from all backgrounds is what makes us stronger and best prepared to meet our business goals.
   

  

 We see the career breaks as opportunities not obstacles. Through The Global Returners program, we support professionals looking to restart their careers after an extended absence from the workforce (e.g. time out caring for family, parental leave, national service, sabbatical and/or starting an own venture).
   

  

 Come bring your difference and see what is possible for you at BAT. Learn more about our culture and our award winning employee experience here.
   

  

 If you require any reasonable adjustments or accommodations to help you perform at your best during the recruitment process, you are encouraged to notify us. We are fully committed to support you by making appropriate arrangements for you to demonstrate your full potential.**

title: Software Engineering Manager - Ubuntu Linux Kernel
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring Software Engineering Managers to lead technical teams in the various aspects of the delivery and ongoing support and maintenance of all Linux kernels provided by the Ubuntu Linux distribution. As the Linux kernel itself is now quite broad, so are the technical domains and challenges involved, ranging from integrating support for bleeding-edge hardware into the latest Ubuntu kernels, to expanding the range of execution environments available to Ubuntu, to the complexities inherent in applying the latest fixes and updates to all of the >100 Ubuntu Linux kernels under active support during our Stable Release Update cycles.
   

  

 This role would suit either an experienced manager of high performing software development teams, or a very proficient technical lead who is excited to take on a management responsibility. You will need to be passionate about Linux and aspire to be an integral part in its distribution to millions of users worldwide.
   

  

 As an Engineering Manager at Canonical, your primary responsibility is to your team: helping them grow as engineers, do important and satisfying work, and have a great time while doing it. Technical leadership experience and a background in software engineering are necessary prerequisites for this role. You will be expected to lead, challenge, and develop strong engineers, positively influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Working from home, worldwide. We have kernel teams and openings in every time zone and with the notable exception of Taipei, Taiwan, have no offices and therefore no pressure to work from an office.
   

  

**The role entails**
* Leading a distributed team of software engineers in your geographic region in distinct aspects of delivery of all Linux kernels for the Ubuntu Linux distribution
* Taking ownership of particular aspects of Ubuntu Linux which can include but not be limited to:
+ Working with silicon or cloud partners to implement Linux kernels optimised for their execution environments
+ Ensuring Ubuntu Linux is able to run on a wide range of diverse hardware platforms
+ Definition and execution of the stringent quality control standards expected by the Ubuntu user community
+ Mitigation of the latest security threats and exploits to the Linux kernel
+ Strong process automation as it pertains to the build, test, and delivery of the Linux kernel

* Engagement with other teams at Canonical, the open source community and commercial partners


**What we are looking for in you**
* Significant programming experience in C, with Python, Golang, or other like languages also highly regarded
* Substantial experience with operating system kernel internals and concepts, Linux would be highly regarded but not essential
* Demonstrated experience managing or leading a team of software engineers
* Ability to coordinate between multiple distinct teams of differing technical focus to achieve common goals
* Familiarity with version control practices, ideally with git
* Prior experience developing with software packaging formats, with direct Ubuntu/Debian/Snap experience being highly regarded
* Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
* Ability to travel internationally twice a year for company events up to two weeks long


**Nice-to-have skills**
* Demonstrated experience with kernel patching and debugging
* Strong grasp of device drivers, BSP's, and other low level system engineering
* Solid background in driving CI/CD and process automation initiatives
* Prior public involvement with an open source project


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Category Manager to Nelco
description:
Do you possess a sharp strategic mindset and a deep passion for product development and supplier partnerships? Are you energized by a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment where growth, ingenuity, and collaboration are at the core of success? If you’re eager to make a significant impact in a expanding company with a strong foothold in the market, this is the challenge you’ve been waiting for!
 



  





**Your future employer** 




 Nelco develops products and concepts in close collaboration with leading manufacturers for the distribution of electrical components, installation materials, tools, and cables. With a strong focus on customer service, a competitive product range, and efficient logistics, Nelco has established itself as one of Europe’s leading companies in connectivity and cable management.
 



 Nelco supplies leading electrical and electronics wholesalers, retailers, and manufacturing industries across various sectors, including automotive, construction, aviation, food, railway, offshore, and energy. Our state-of-the-art facilities house our headquarters, production, product development, testing facility, showroom, and warehouse, strategically located just 5 minutes from Arlanda Airport.
 



  





**What does a day at the company look like?** 




 Category Managers at Nelco AB hold the commercial responsibility for business development within their respective product areas. Your main tasks will include:
 


* Identifying and negotiating with suppliers to secure the best pricing, quality, and terms.
* Managing the product assortment, ensuring profitability and market alignment.
* Collaborating with the sales team to develop pricing strategies and provide product expertise.
* Driving marketing initiatives, including packaging, product presentations, and campaign planning.
* Monitoring key performance indicators like turnover, product profitability, and inventory levels.



  





 This is an exciting opportunity for someone who thrives in a role that combines strategic planning, negotiation, and hands-on product management. The position is responsible for one of four categories within the company and reports to Business Development Manager. As part of the role, you will also take a few business trips per year within Europe and Asia, visiting suppliers, attending industry trade fairs, and exploring new business opportunities.
 



  





**Who are you?** 




 We are looking for a strategic, analytical, and commercially driven professional with a strong internal drive and a competitive instinct. You are curious yet humble, confident in your expertise but always eager to learn and improve. To succeed in this role, you should have a post-secondary education and a strong technical understanding, enabling you to navigate complex product categories and supplier relationships.
 



  





 With experience in purchasing, category management, or product development, you excel in negotiation, pricing strategies, and market analysis. Excellent communication skills in English are essential, and proficiency in Swedish is a plus.
 



  





**Is this your perfect match?** 




 We’d be thrilled to receive your application! Please submit it through effektiv.se as soon as possible, as we will be conducting interviews on an ongoing basis. If you have any questions or would like more information about the position, feel free to contact Elin Fernström at elin.fernstrom@effektiv.se. We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





**About Team Effektiv** 




 Effektiv is the innovative and personal company in recruitment, staffing, coaching, matching, and interim solutions. Our roots in sports and team spirit influence the company; we work in teams in our staffing and recruitment processes, and sponsoring sports clubs is a significant part of our commitment. As a candidate, we aim to provide that extra touch, ensuring a great experience throughout the entire recruitment process, as evidenced by our recognition as Recruitment Company of the Year. Effektiv's core values are Happy, Exploratory, Long-term, and Resourceful, forming the acronym GOLD in Swedish. Effektiv strives to achieve gold with its candidates, consultants, clients, and partners every day. This is a direct recruitment, which means that Effektiv is responsible for the recruitment process, and you will be employed directly by the client company.

title: Säkerhetschef
description:
Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. Vi är specialister inom stadsutveckling, arkitektur och infrastruktur som bygger samhällen som håller.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 I rollen som Säkerhetschef hos oss på Tyréns kommer du tillhöra
 *Business Support & Business Development* 
 som består av totalt cirka 80 personer, specialiserade inom områdena IT, juridik, HR & Payroll, Marknad & Kommunikation, Hållbarhet & Kvalitet, Säkerhet, Fastighet & Kontor samt Strategy & Project Office. Vi arbetar alla både strategiskt och operativt, med förvaltning och utveckling, samt stöd och rådgivning med syftet att bidra till att förverkliga Tyréns affär:
 *Jobba med samhällsbyggnad med målet att skapa bättre förutsättningar för dagens och framtidens städer.*
 Du rapporterar till Head of Business Support & Business Development och ingår i dennes ledningsgrupp. Tjänsten är placerad på Tyréns huvudkontor på Södermalm, Stockholm. Resor förekommer inom Sverige och till andra länder inom koncernen.
   

  

 I denna roll kommer du exempelvis jobba med att:
   

  

* Ansvara operativt och strategisk för vårt säkerhetsarbete vilket innefattar säkerhetsskydd, fysisk säkerhet, informationssäkerhet och personalsäkerhet
* Ingå i krisledningsgruppen samt bidra i samband med visselblåsning
* Arbeta med tillämpningen av säkerhetsskyddslagen och du arbetar aktivt för att utveckla, skapa förutsättningar för och sprida en god säkerhetskultur på Tyréns


 Du kommer arbeta strategisk och operativt nära verksamheten i bland annat våra anbud och uppdrag. I kontakt med kund kommer du agera stöd och rådgivare för tillämpning av gällande lagstiftning. Som Säkerhetschef har du kontinuerlig och nära dialog internt med bl a kvalitetschef, IT-chef och kontorschefer och till stöd i arbetet har du säkerhetssamordnare och resurser i samband med säkerhetsprövning.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
* Fantastiska kollegor och många specialister inom våra olika kompetensområden.
* En värderingsdriven kultur där Connect, Create & Challenge är våra ledord.
* En stimulerande arbetsmiljö i våra lokaler med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån del av din arbetstid.
* Möjlighet att jobba med innovationsprojekt.
* Kompetensutveckling anpassad efter dig.
* Sociala aktiviteter, både på och efter ordinarie arbetstid.
* Extra lediga dagar utöver dina semesterdagar, vi är t.ex. alltid lediga med lön dagarna mellan jul och nyår.
* Flertalet personalförmåner via vår förmånsportal.
* Kollektivavtal som vi tecknat med Innovationsföretagen (Almega).


 Klicka här för att läsa mer om oss, vilken typ av projekt vi jobbar med, vilka utvecklingsmöjligheter som finns, våra innovationer, läsa bloggar och lyssna på våra medarbetares podcasts.
   

  

**Vi söker**
 För att lyckas och trivas i rollen bör du ha:
   

  

* Högskole– eller universitetsutbildning alternativt längre relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet i en ansvarig befattning där du arbetat operativt och strategisk med säkerhetsskydd och fysisk skydd
* Praktisk erfarenhet av tillämpning av lagstiftningen om säkerhetsskyddad upphandling


 Meriterande är erfarenhet/kunskap inom:
   

  

* Informationssäkerhet, personalsäkerhet samt IT säkerhet


 Personliga egenskaper vi tror passar rollen och vår företagskultur:
   

  

* Drivande och kan gå från ord till handling på ett strukturerat och självständigt sätt
* Kommunikativ förmåga där du förstår kundens behov och är lyhörd för verksamheten
* Affärsmässig ledare som på ett innovativt och lösningsorienterat sätt driver det långsiktiga strategiska arbetet och samtidigt tar dig an den verksamhetsnära/operativa rollen
* Det är viktigt att du även förstår vikten av att arbeta värderingsstyrt och delar Tyréns värdegrund, ”Create, Challenge & Connect”


 För denna tjänst ser vi att du hanterar det svenska och engelska språket i både tal och skrift för att kunna tillmötesgå våra kunder och kollegors behov.
   

  

 Som Säkerhetschef är du placerad i säkerhetsklass varför godkänd säkerhetsprövning är ett krav. I den här rekryteringen kommer även bakgrundskontroll och tester ingå i processen.
   

  

**Ansöka**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Level Recruitment. Vi ber er därför att ansöka via deras annons som du når genom att klicka här.
   

  

 Personligt brev är inte ett krav hos oss, men kommer naturligtvis läsas om det bifogas.
   

  

 Vi rekryterar löpande, så skicka gärna din ansökan redan idag då tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Med hänvisning till GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar per mejl utan hanterar enbart ansökningar som kommer in via ansökningslänken.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten eller har frågor? Då är du välkommen att kontakta:
   

  

 Sissel Strand
   

  

 Senior Rekryteringskonsult, Level recruitment
   

  

 Mejl: sissel.strand@levelrecruitment.se
   

  

 Telefon: 08-120 50 426
   

  

 Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. I samspel med kunder och partners skapar vi hållbara lösningar inom stadsutveckling och infrastruktur. Tyrénskoncernen har 3 000 medarbetare med verksamhet i Sverige, Storbritannien, Estland, Litauen, Polen, Bulgarien och Kanada. Tyréns är stiftelseägt och vår ägandeform gör det möjligt för oss att satsa målmedvetet på forskning och innovation inom samhällsbyggnadsområdet. Vi drivs av nyfikenhet och har ett nära samarbete med universitet och högskolor.
   

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

 Tillbaka

title: Talent Acquisition Leader
description:
Since 1965, Stoneridge has designed and manufactured advanced, award-winning technologies including driveline and transmission actuation systems, vision systems, emissions control systems, safety systems, and security and monitoring systems for vehicle OEMs in the commercial vehicle, automotive, off-highway and agricultural vehicle markets. We’re focused on the areas of greatest market need – both today and tomorrow. Our core products and technologies are aligned with industry megatrends including safety and security, vehicle intelligence, fuel efficiency and emissions. Join the Stoneridge Team as we continue to build upon our strong history and reputation for quality products to deliver innovative products and systems that address a need, exceed our customers’ expectations, and motivate our team.
   

  

**Talent Acquisition Leader - Europe**
 As the Talent Acquisition Leader for Europe, you will have responsibility to lead and manage the talent acquisition activities for the European Region. Responsibilities will include management of in-house recruiters and external recruitment partners, ensure best-in-class recruitment processes and employer branding strategies. The position will be based in Stockholm (Solna), and is part of the Global Talent Acquisition Team, reporting to our Director, Global Talent Management. You will also have a dotted line reporting to our Vice President, Human Resources for Stoneridge Electronics, who is located in our Stockholm office.
   

  

 Ideal candidates should have several years of corporate recruitment experience, recruiting a wide range of roles, mainly within the tech industry. This is a hands-on role which will include full life cycle recruiting activities for corporate function positions in our Stockholm HQ. You will also work on a strategic level with how to attract the best talent and to set up effective employer branding activities within Europe and collaborate closely with local HR.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Lead and execute end-to-end recruitment processes regionally in a timely manner, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
* Develop and implement recruitment strategies to identify and hire qualified candidates for assigned open positions in Europe, addressing regional needs and talent market dynamics.
* Leverage analytics and key performance indicators (KPIs) to drive continuous improvement in recruitment processes.
* Optimize the global talent acquisition life cycle.
* Facilitate full-life cycle recruitment activities including advertising, candidate sourcing/head hunting and screening, offer, presentation and negotiation, and pre-employment onboarding activities.
* Develop connections with various candidate sources to build pipelines of talent.
* Project Leader for development and maintenance of EVP (Employer Value Proposition) and Global Branding.
* Localizing Employer Branding for European Region
* Stay at the forefront of industry trends, candidate market and best practices by actively participating in workshops, conferences, and training sessions-
* Share knowledge with the internal team and implement innovative recruitment techniques.
* Collaborate with leaders on staffing needs to evaluate, prioritize, and create action plans around staffing gaps and hiring needs.
* Build strong partnerships with internal teams to enhance the overall recruitment experience.
* Ensuring an exceptional candidate experience throughout the recruitment process, reinforcing our employer brand.


**Personal competencies**
 As an individual, you can communicate efficiently, build strong relationships and influence others. You have excellent customer service skills and the possibility to work efficiently with all levels of the organization, supporting managers in various departments. We also believe you have a can-do attitude and see possibilities and improvement areas and are driven and able to execute and work independently as well as in a team.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or related field.
* A minimum of 5 years of corporate recruiting experience working with high volume recruiting in a Human Resources function, preferably in the automotive or tech industry.
* Previous experience in full life cycle recruiting activities for engineering and corporate function positions.
* Proficient English-speaking knowledge is a must since we are a global company.
* Highly computer literate with experience working with MS Office such as outlook, PowerPoint, teams and excel.
* General knowledge of employment laws and practices, especially as they pertain to recruitment.
* Full understanding of HR functions and best practices.
* Prior experience in an HR metrics-driven organization.
* It’s an additional qualification if you have experience of working with Workday or similar HRIS System. It is also a plus if you have previous experience building and implementing recruitment strategies and previous experience building and managing employer branding activities.

title: Security and SHEQ Manager, Sweden/DACH
description:
*At Nexus, part of French IN Groupe, we secure the new society that emerges in the ever-expanding world of digital transformation. By challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we’re developing technology for high-demand global clients. Nexus’ Smart ID solutions and IoT platforms are changing how we perceive trusted identities. Do you want to be a part of our journey?*
**Olivier Dussutour** 
 , our CEO, is seeking for a Security and SHEQ (Safety, Health, Environment, and Quality) Manager to uphold top standards of security, safety and quality frameworks.
   

  

 If you thrive in tech and international environments this might be the right opportunity for you. You will have the opportunity to shape and impact a security-aware organization across Europe, helping us reinforce our core business of trust.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Engage with various departments to cultivate a culture of safety and continuous improvement.
* Lead initiatives that prioritize sustainability and environmental responsibility.
* At Nexus, part of IN Groupe, we are leaders in high-tech trust and safety solutions. As a Security and SHEQ Manager, you'll be a pivotal player in a company where trust is central. Your work will have a significant impact on our commitment to innovation and the standards we set in the industry.


 Want to know more? Check out our value proposition: To work with us!
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Nexus**
 As a Security and SHEQ Manager, you will be the key figure overseeing comprehensive security programs across the Nordics and Germany, with a primary focus on general security and safety. A special focus will be on physical security and business continuity. You will also act as the Chief of security in tenders and in client interactions. You will develop and implement strategies to protect assets, facilities, and personnel, while also managing SHEQ systems to promote a culture of safety, compliance, and operational excellence throughout the organization.
   

  

 Responsibilities includes
   

  

* Develop and implement comprehensive physical security policies, protocols and procedures to safeguard facilities, personnel, and assets.
* Work closely with our corporate information security team to ensure seamless integration of cybersecurity and physical security measures for a unified security approach.
* Lead and conduct risk assessments for both physical security and SHEQ aspects; develop and execute effective mitigation strategies.
* Manage security personnel and coordinate with facilities management to maintain secure environments across locations.
* Develop, implement, and maintain robust SHEQ management systems in compliance with regulatory standards and organizational goals and liaison with group counterparts to cascade group policy.
* Lead incident investigations related to security breaches and SHEQ incidents; implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence.
* Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) for SHEQ initiatives; report on performance to senior management.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance safety, environmental sustainability, and overall quality standards organization-wide.


**About You**
* You take pride in your meticulous approach, ensuring accuracy and thoroughness in every task.
* You confidently express your ideas and decisions, driving projects forward effectively.
* You enjoy anticipating needs and opportunities, taking initiative to address issues and drive improvements.
* You excel at analyzing complex situations, deriving meaningful insights from data.
* You maintain positivity and adaptability in overcoming challenges and setbacks.


**Qualifications**
* You possess a relevant academic degree.
* You are experienced in the Security field.
* You are fluent in Swedish and proficient English.
* You are experienced with ISO 9001.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* You are experienced in Tech and infrastructure.
* You are familiar with ISO 27001, ISO 14001 and TISAX.
* You are experienced in SOA classification.


**About Your Application**
 Please note that due to summer vacations, the feedback on applications may be slower during the month of July. However, we encourage you to apply as we will review all applications and respond as soon as possible.
   

  

**Not sure you meet 100% of the qualifications?**
 At Nexus, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.
   

  

**Please upload your CV in English or Swedish.**
 Transparency, security, and trust are the core of our company; therefore, the final candidate will be subjected to a background check before training.
   

  

 Nexus is an equal-opportunity employer. We truly believe in being ONE Nexus. You are welcomed at Nexus for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you look like. Our technology is for everyone, and so is our workplace. So, bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background to thrive, collaborate, and be forward-thinking! It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep innovating the way we secure the world.

title: Commercial Development Manager
description:
**Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the #1 e-scooter service in Europe, operating in 100+ cities with over 200 MILLION rides to date. It has been an amazing journey and we have no intention of stopping now! To support us in driving the next phase of our growth, we are looking for a Commercial Development Manager to join us at HQ in Stockholm. Are you ready for the voyage of a lifetime?**
**Want to hear more about the Commercial Optimisation team? Check out what our Head of Commercial Optimisation Rikard Ohlsén has to say!**
**YOUR MISSION AT VOI**
**Role**
 As
 **Commercial Development Manager** 
 you will be at the heart of our commercial operations, using data-driven insights to unlock revenue opportunities, and maximise monetisation and user retention. In this role, you will collaborate closely with our market leaders and support them with commercial and pricing recommendations, and drive cross-functional collaboration across HQ and local markets. This will include:
   

  

**Data Analysis & Reporting**
* Leverage data and analysis to identify strategic opportunities and uncover actionable insights to shape price- and discount recommendations
* Deliver clear and actionable reports on the impact of A/B tests and commercial initiatives
* Track progress against set KPIs, and drive continuous improvements and iteration on strategies


**Market Collaboration & Optimisation**
* Monitor market trends and performance, and collaborate continuously with market leaders to identify region-specific challenges and opportunities
* Develop and execute tailored price- and discount strategies to improve revenue growth and user retention


**Stakeholder & Process Management**
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders and act as the bridge between central- and local teams to ensure alignment key priorities
* Manage initiative timelines, stakeholder communications, and deliverables to ensure successful outcomes


**Building Knowledge & Impact**
* Partner with senior team members to deepen understanding of user and market development to shape price optimisation and rider segmentation strategies
* Contribute to hypothesis generation, conduct simulations and A/B test, to identify price and discount opportunities that can drive incremental revenue impact
* Collaborate continuously across the organisation to to develop tools and processes, implement solutions and improve data-driven decision-making across the organisation


**What You Need To Embark**
 We are looking for a result-oriented, analytical and structured person with the ability to work with senior stakeholders on multiple projects in a fast-paced dynamic environment. In addition to being fluent in English, we believe the right person has:
   

  

* Bachelors’s degree in Engineering, Finance, Business or similar
* Experience as a management consultant or working with commercial development in a fast-moving company
* Experience from working with excel, and ability to conduct numeric analysis and understand the underlying drivers of specific metrics
* Ability to influence and communicate complex topics efficiently with senior internal stakeholders, verbally and in writing
* Experience from SQL and data visualisation tools is a merit


**WHY VOI?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voyage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

* Join a fast-moving scaleup and the #1 e-scooter operator in Europe
* Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
* Have a key role in advising commercial commitments and optimising top-line performance across Northern Europe
* Collaborate with inspiring, motivated, supportive and fun colleagues working towards a common goal
* Join the micromobility revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: Power Platform Konsult till team Columbus Dynamics Stockholm 💫
description:
*Ser du också fram emot sommarsolen? Här på Columbus behöver vi inte förlora några soliga dagar. Vi förlorar inte en enda solstråle på att sitta på kontoret – istället bestämmer vi själva var vi vill jobba. Är det kanske på altanen, balkongen eller på ett av våra härliga kontor runt om i Sverige?🌞* 
*Det är upp till dig.*
*Som Power Platform Consult hos oss får du just den friheten. Det är inte bara jobbet som vi erbjuder, toppen kollegor och arbetsuppgifter där du gör det du är bäst på - vart det än passar dig. Det här blir alltså riktigt bra!🎉*
 Vad kommer du göra hos oss?
   

  

 Du kommer att hänga med ett gott gäng som alla tycker om att göra arbetslivet lite enklare för andra. Du kommer att jobba med Power Platform primärt kopplat till våra Dynamicsprojekt, och skapa lösningar som inte bara fungerar, utan som faktiskt får dig att känna dig lite som en superhjälte. Ja, vi vet, det låter lite klyschigt, men när en kund tackar dig för att du gjort deras dag tio gånger enklare – då känns det helt ok att vara den där hjälten 😎
   

  

 Vad behöver du ha med dig?
   

  

 Vi tror att du har några års erfarenhet inom Power Platform – antingen internt eller externt. Du gillar att jobba tillsammans med andra och kommer bra överens med våra Microsoft Dynamics-specialister. Erfarenhet av supply chain- och/eller finansprocesser är meriterande. Flytande i både svenska och engelska? Kanon, då kan du snacka med både kunder och kollegor utan problem. Och så gillar du att bygga förtroende hos dina kunder, såklart.
   

  

 Varför rekryterar vi?
   

  

 Vi startar nu upp ett dedikerat Power Platform-team inom vårt affärsområde Dynamics. Målet är att skapa smarta, skräddarsydda applikationer och automatiserade flöden som stärker vår förmåga att leverera värde till våra kunder. Med det nya teamet vill vi ytterligare förstärka vårt erbjudande 🚀
   

  

 Men det viktigaste?
   

  

 Du är nyfiken, inte bara på vart du får bäst ljusinspläpp, utan också på att lära dig mer om Power Platform. Du gillar att utveckla och implementera lösningar som faktiskt gör skillnad. Och även om du saknar högsommaren, så gillar du tanken på att jobba i ett team där man har kul tillsammans, där arbetsuppgifterna är engagerande och där det är helt okej att sucka över vädret tillsammans vid kaffemaskinen.
   

  

 Varför kommer du att trivas här?
   

  

 Du kommer att få göra det du är bra på, tillsammans med människor som uppskattar både dig och det du gör. Och även om solen lyser med sin frånvaro, så kommer teamet att lysa upp din dag (okej, vi vet att det var lite cheesy, men du fattar vad vi menar). Så, vad säger du?
   

  

 Ansökan och nästa steg
   

  

 Hos oss kan du ansöka med din LinkedIn och/eller CV och du behöver inte fylla i några långa frågeformulär. I vår rekryteringsprocess tar vi alltid referenser och genomför en bakgrundskontroll innan anställning eller eventuellt erbjudande ges. Intervjuer kommer hållas löpande. Så vad väntar du på? Vi ser fram emot att höra av dig!😊
   

  

 Om Columbus
   

  

 Columbus är ett värdestyrt bolag med engagerade medarbetare som stöttar varandra i både framgång som motgång. Att ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid är en självklarhet. Det kan vara allt från hämtning och lämning på förskola till väntan av det där paketet som ska levereras hem ”någon gång mellan 10-19”. Dessutom så är vi riktigt bra på att fira framgångar och det är inte ovanligt med fika, lyxfrukost och AW på kontoret. 🥳 På Columbus har vi även trevliga förmåner för att stötta våra medarbetare i livets olika stadier.
   

  

 Jobba på Columbus
   

  

 Spana in vårt Insta-flöde för att få en bild av
 **hur det är att jobba hos oss** 
 genom våra kollegor. Klicka på bilden för att komma till Instagram-kontot.
   

  

  

  

**Helt ofiltrerat** 
 har vi samlat in omdömen från nuvarande och tidigare kollegor. Klicka nedan för att läsa mer.

title: Exchange-specialist
description:
**Om oss**
 Everlight är konsultbolaget med din karriär i fokus. Här finns det en hel plattform av möjligheter och karriärvägar att vandra som anställd konsult, underkonsult eller via direktrekrytering. Här finns drivna och ambitiösa kollegor, stöd och bollplank att vända sig till och framförallt finns det glädje och transparens!
   

  

**Om uppdraget**
 Till en av våra kunder söker vi nu en
 **Förvaltare Exchange** 
 . Kunden har under de senaste åren genomfört en omfattande transformation till Microsoft 365 och behöver nu en erfaren specialist för att förvalta och vidareutveckla sin Exchange-miljö. Just nu pågår ett stort uppgraderingsprojekt som kräver omfattande förändringar av befintlig On-Premises-infrastruktur, där målet är att migrera delar av systemet till Exchange Online.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du bör beskrivas som:
   

  

* Trygg och erfaren inom Exchange, både On-Prem och Cloud.
* Strukturerad och analytisk med förmåga att hantera komplexa IT-miljöer.
* Kommunikativ och lösningsorienterad, van att samarbeta med både interna och externa parter.
* Van att arbeta inom regulatoriskt styrda verksamheter och har förståelse för säkerhetskrav och compliance.


**Arbetsuppgifter**
**I Rollen Som Förvaltare Exchange Kommer Du Att**
* Förvalta och vidareutveckla kundens Exchange-miljö, både On-Prem och Exchange Online.
* Samarbeta med interna avdelningar och externa driftleverantörer för att optimera Exchange-tjänsterna.
* Hantera frågor från verksamheten relaterade till mail, mailboxar, anslutningar och kalenderfunktioner.
* Uppdatera och tydliggöra tjänstebeskrivningen för Exchange och definiera ansvar mellan beställare och driftleverantör.
* Arbeta med avtalsuppdateringar och förvaltning av Exchange-relaterade tjänster.
* Stötta Servicedesk med ärenden, rutiner och processförbättringar kopplade till Exchange.
* Hantera planering, dokumentation och godkännande av förändringar i Exchange-miljön.
* Delta i uppgraderingsprojekt och stötta migreringsarbetet från On-Prem till Exchange Online.
* Se över och implementera nya lösningar samt hålla sig uppdaterad kring omvärldsutveckling inom Exchange och M365.


**För rollen ska du ha...**
* Minst fem års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av att administrera och hantera Microsoft Exchange On-Prem, inklusive konfiguration, underhåll och felsökning.
* Minst två uppdrag där konsulten arbetat med IT-förvaltning och drift, inklusive patchning, förändringshantering och registervård, under de senaste 15 åren.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet från minst två projekt där konsulten har arbetat med ITIL och servicedesk-processer, under de senaste 10 åren.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet från minst två projekt där konsulten har samverkat med andra avdelningar för att samordna tekniska lösningar, kravställning, incidenthantering eller förändringsarbete inom Exchange-miljön (Exchange On-Prem och/eller Exchange Online) under de senaste 10 åren.


**Mervärdeskrav** 
*(ger poäng vid utvärdering)*
* Erfarenhet av minst två tidigare uppdrag som innefattar mailmigrering
* Minst tre års arbetslivserfarenhet av förändringsledning kopplat till uppgraderingsprojekt i IT-miljöer
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet från minst två uppdrag inom regulatoriskt styrda verksamheter, t.ex. myndigheter eller offentlig verksamhet


**Placering och omfattning**
 På kontor i
 **Stockholm** 
 , med viss möjlighet till distansarbete.
   

  

 Uppdraget har en omfattning på
 **100%** 
 och är en konsultanställning via Everlight.
   

  

**Vill du vara en del av denna förändringsresa?**
 Vi söker en
 **erfaren och engagerad Exchange-specialist** 
 som vill bidra till en
 **stabil, säker och effektiv IT-miljö** 
 . Låter detta som en utmaning för dig? Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
description:
As the Senior Product Marketing Manager for Contraband, our upcoming AAA co-op open world action game and new IP published by Microsoft Xbox Game Studios, you are the critical tactician between the game leadership team, the Xbox Game Studios Marketing team, and our marketing partners.
   

  

 You will translate player needs, the product strategy, and our marketing goals into successful marketing activities that drive demand, either directly or working through our publisher.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Work as an embedded member of the game leadership team providing product marketing expertise.
* Collaborate closely with our publisher's Marketing team at Xbox Game Studios, and our Marketing partners
* Inform the Launch campaign strategy, plan marketing beats and content releases, and manage execution.
* Establish the marketing roadmap and asset plan for the Live service
* Maintain updated factsheets for the product, communicating all development roadmap changes.
* Manage the development of the brand voice (including style, tone & personality).
* Write the master marketing copy in collaboration with our publisher to ensure best practice.
* Drive the creation of marketing assets in close collaboration with our creative team, publisher, and external agencies.
* Propose campaign messaging using player and product insights in partnership with our publishers’ marketing teams.


**Who You Are**
* A seasoned Product marketer with over 5 years of experience.
* Experienced in game launches and live services across PC and console.
* Deep understanding of the current and future trends of the gaming industry and player motivations.
* Able to proactively identify cultural shifts and opportunities, and to set long-term goals.
* A firm believer in collaboration and transparency, able to balance the feedback and needs of various stakeholders.
* Able to juggle internal and external communications effectively, with proven experience working with multilevel stakeholders in multinational matrixed organizations.
* Previous experience at an international games publisher or developer is required.
* Not afraid to get hands-on to ensure marketing resonates well with the audience.
* An avid gaming enthusiast who enjoys the thrill of a AAA explosive action experience.


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Group Manager Industrial Training - Scania Academy
description:
*Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.*
**Role Summary**
 Learning and growth are two of the absolute fundamentals for Scania to be the leader in driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. At Scania Academy, our mission is to work with continuous learning and competence development to support Scania’s transformation.
   

  

 We are now looking for a group manager to the Industrial Training Team. In this role you will lead a group of Industrial Trainers.
   

  

 The Industrial Training Team offers trainings within Scania Production System (SPS). SPS is based on our shared values, principles and methods which together define how we should conduct our operations in an efficient and sustainable manner. We are also responsible for training new employees within production and logistic. The main training programs include introduction training for blue-collar workers and SPS training for support functions and leaders within PPL (Procurement, Production, Logistics). The team consists of six employees and as their manager, one of your most important tasks is to give your team the conditions to develop and grow.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* You will coach and support your team to deliver and develop trainings to maximize business value.
* You will plan, organize, and develop trainings in cooperation with course owners, stakeholders and Scania Academy.
* You will also act as the main contact for training globally and play an important role in the strategic work.


**Who You Are**
 We are looking for someone with a strong passion for competence development and a firm belief that investing in people is a key success factor for Scania. You should have the ability to motivate, engage, and develop your team while demonstrating solid leadership qualities and a hands-on approach. A strong understanding and interest in SPS, Scania Way, and Lean principles are essential, along with the ability to navigate between strategic and operational tasks. Your communication style should be open and transparent, allowing you to maintain a close dialogue with stakeholders.
   

  

 Fluency in both Swedish and English is required, as well as a relevant university degree or equivalent knowledge.
   

  

 You thrive in and have the ability to focus in a constantly changing environment. You can effectively lead both yourself and others and you should be prepared to work in a global setting, collaborating with others and working as part of a team. You have a mindset focused on delivering continuous value, you are self-driven, responsible, and proactive. Embracing a Growth Mindset is important, as is the courage and curiosity to experiment and learn from both successes and setbacks. You are a self-driven learner and take responsible for your own competence development. You think it is important to be data driven and like to work with data.
   

  

 We are looking for someone with leadership experience, preferably from a managerial role. Experience within production or logistics at Scania or one of the TRATON brands is valuable, as well as a background in learning and development.
   

  

**Scania offers**
 We offer a dynamic workplace with diverse and challenging tasks, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 We have a broad offer of personnel benefits ranging from health allowance to performance bonuses. Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

 Our corporate culture is characterized by openness, diversity, and respect for the individual.
   

  

**Application**
 We are dedicated to build a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you are excited about this role but your experience does not align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway.  We hire for attitude and train for skills. You will learn along the way.
   

  

 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-04-03. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Anna de Haan, Director Industrial Competence Development HACB +46 76 6975879
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Sales Excellence Lead
description:
***This job is with Microsoft, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Overview**
 The Sales Excellence Lead is a unique opportunity to engage with, and influence, senior decision-makers across our sales organisation, and you play an integral part in our ability to deliver effectively and efficiently the revenue we commit to as a region.
   

  

 You will be fundamental to how our sales teams align to our internal methodology and practices, as you will be responsible for providing coaching and guidance while nurturing relationships across the region and strive for excellence across our sales motions. It’s your ability to help build consistent sales discipline and governance, and gather insights across multiple segments and roles, that will enable you to be an influential factor in our business’ success.
   

  

 Embrace this challenge and enhance your management capability and commercial acumen, whilst being a trusted advisor to the country leadership team.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 With an ability to communicate with executive level stakeholders and build relationships across a global organisation, you will be well positioned for success in this role. Some of the other knowledge and skills you will be able to demonstrate include:
   

  

* Experience in a sales or account management role
* A history working for largescale, matrix structured enterprise organisations
* Demonstrable experience with data analysis and interpreting sales metrics to drive business outcomes or inform business decisions.
* Experience of managing relationships with senior level stakeholders
* A background coaching and guiding sales teams and managers
* Fluency in English, Swedish- preffered.


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
   

  

 Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Activate sponsorship within segment leaders for the Account/Portfolio Partner Business Plan.
* Define and drive a predictable rhythm of connection (ROC) in collaboration with peers and leadership.
* Guide sales teams and leadership on sales motions and strategies for opportunity management.
* Develop segment strategy for segmentation, territory planning, and quota setting.
* Coach and build relationships with sales leaders to execute key priorities.
* Drive awareness and clarity of Corporate or TimeZone programs.
* Lead optimization and improvement in sales team processes and capabilities.
* Identify trends on sales challenges or blockers.
* Lead innovations in analytics on key revenue drivers.
* Drive sales process discipline and adherence to standards in collaboration with sales leaders.
* Support segment leader capacity as a senior leader. Represents the segment as an internal advocate and an extension of the segment leadership.

title: Program Director
company_industry: Administration of Justice and Truck Transportation
description:
**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





 We are happy to invite applications for exciting internship opportunities at TCS. The internship allows you to gain unique and real-life perspectives in solving challenges for TCS and its Customers.
 



  





**Role: Program Director** 




**Experience (Years): 17+ Years** 




**Language requirement: Swedish & English** 




  





**Must-Have:** 




  





**1)Program Leadership:** 



* Lead and oversee SAP conversion program and optimization projects, ensuring they align with overall business objectives and deliver value to the organization.
* Establish and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders across the business to secure their involvement and commitment throughout the project.



  





**2)Business Alignment:** 



* Ensure that the program’s goals are closely aligned with the company’s strategic business objectives.
* Work closely with senior executives and business leaders to understand their needs and ensure these are reflected in the SAP implementation.



  





**3)Communication Strategy:** 



* Develop and execute comprehensive communication plans to keep all stakeholders informed and engaged.
* Ensure that project updates, milestones, and changes are effectively communicated across the organization.



  





**4)Project Management:** 



* Oversee the day-to-day management of the SAP program, ensuring that projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.
* Identify, manage, and mitigate project risks and issues to ensure successful project outcomes.



  





**5)Performance Monitoring:** 



* Track and report on program performance, providing regular updates to senior management.
* Ensure that all deliverables meet the required quality standards and business requirements.



  





**Experience required:** 



* Proven experience as a Senior Program Director or Senior Project Director, with a strong track record of leading large-scale SAP implementation and optimization projects.
* Experience in aligning complex IT projects with business objectives in a global or multinational company.



  





**Skills:** 



* Excellent English language skills, both written and spoken.
* Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Expertise in developing and executing communication strategies for large projects.
* Deep understanding of SAP systems and their implementation in large organizations.



  





**Technical Skills:** 



* Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies.
* Strong understanding of SAP software, particularly in implementation and optimization contexts.



  





**Good to have:** 



* Strong SAP S/4 implementation Experience
* Knowledge in Retail business



  





**Responsibility of / Expectations from the Role** 



* Proven experience as a Senior Program Director or Senior Project Director, with a strong track record of leading
* Experience in aligning complex IT projects with business objectives in a global or multinational company
* Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies
* Deep understanding of SAP systems and their implementation in large organizations
* Should be focused in on-time delivery



  





**We look forward to receiving your application via r.naveen2@tcs.com** 




  





**Privacy Note:** 




**https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice**

title: Technical Program Manager
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 Technical Program Manager (CRM Integrations)
   

  

 We are seeking a Technical Program Manager to help scale Wolt engineering, enhance process efficiency, and uphold our commitment to operational excellence. This role is pivotal, placing you at the core of a forward-thinking team dedicated to delivering outstanding results. If you're looking for an opportunity where your technical program management expertise and ability to drive impact truly matter, this is it.
   

  

 As a Technical Program Manager, you will facilitate collaboration between business, product, and engineering teams. Your primary goals include driving technical programs that span multiple teams, defining and tracking key performance metrics, proactively communicating status and risks, and ensuring alignment on priorities.
   

  

 The scope is broad, and the responsibilities run deep. The role requires wide technical understanding, world-class program management skills, a strong will to win hearts and minds, top-notch orchestration, and the cultural approach and attitude to make it all happen.
   

  

 The Technical Program Manager is data driven, passionate about the craft of software engineering, a jack/jill of all trades and a master of some. They advocate for complex technical programs across the organization, ensuring alignment and influencing without authority. They define, groom, facilitate, and ultimately own the technical programs they are running.
   

  

 This role will be based in Berlin (preferably), Helsinki or Stockholm, with flexible office or home-based work opportunities.
   

  

 The main responsibilities include:
   

  

* Owning cross-organizational technical programs
* Running technical initiatives across teams, groups and business units, ensuring alignment with requirements and business objectives.
* Deep dive into unclear areas, identify the underlying problems, and guides teams in developing scalable solutions
* Managing stakeholders in engineering, product, legal, sales, operations and account management teams
* Acting as a catalyst, significantly increasing the efficiency of product, engineering and business teams working together


 Helping to run engineering at scale
   

  

* Working with various internal teams, engineering, product and business leaders to define key technical initiatives
* Building alignment with team and organizational roadmaps to include key initiatives, define priorities, and ensure adherence to industry standards, regulations and internal policies.
* Identifying key metrics and making sure they are up-to-date and have escalation or remediation plans in place if they exceed guardrails
* Building business-driven cases for technical programs to advocate and prioritize them across the organization


 Making the complex simple
   

  

* Deciding and navigating through ambiguity while providing clarity for everyone in the organization
* Codifying key processes, architectures, and choices
* Constantly improving how we run technical programs
* Supporting teams in building the right things in the right ways


 Our humble expectations
   

  

 We seek candidates with strong prior experience in a similar role within an agile environment, combined with technical expertise. Exceptional project management and interpersonal skills are essential. Experience managing CRM programs is preferred.
   

  

 Next steps
   

  

 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person.
   

  

 The compensation will be a combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Notice to Applicants for Jobs Located in NYC or Remote Jobs Associated With Office in NYC Only
   

  

 We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional process for jobs in NYC and certain features may qualify it as an AEDT in NYC. As part of the hiring and/or promotion process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate submitted applications. We began using Covey Scout for Inbound from August 21, 2023, through December 21, 2023, and resumed using Covey Scout for Inbound again on June 29, 2024.
   

  

 The Covey tool has been reviewed by an independent auditor. Results of the audit may be viewed here: Covey
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Identity Engineer
description:
**Är du en driven Identity Engineer med erfarenhet av Entra ID, AD och hybridmiljöer? Vill du vara med på en spännande transformationsresa in i molnet? får du möjlighet att arbeta hands-on med att implementera och underhålla identitetslösningar i både Azure och Onprem miljöer.**
**Vad erbjuder vi?**
* En dynamisk och utvecklande arbetsmiljö där du får arbeta med den senaste tekniken.
* Möjlighet att påverka och sätta din prägel på våra tekniska lösningar.
* Stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling och karriärvägar.
* En arbetsplats där vi sätter teamet och våra värderingar i första rummet.
* Möjlighet till hybridarbete två dagar i veckan.
* Kollektivavtal, tjänstepension enligt ITP planen och trygghetsförsäkringar.
* Reseförmåner.


 ”Vi är en arbetsplats med ett stort kunnande och en stark drivkraft att ständigt förbättra vår verksamhet. Som en del av Nordic Leisure Travel Group erbjuder vi en spännande och utvecklande miljö med möjlighet till en intern karriär. Vår arbetsglädje och vårt höga engagemang visar sig i vår årliga medarbetarundersökning – och vi är stolta över att vara en arbetsplats där du kan växa och utvecklas.”
   

  

 Nordic Leisure Travel Group ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige och Ving Norge, Globetrotter, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines, hotellkonceptet Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer cirka 1 325 000 resor årligen i de nordiska länderna.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
* Högskoleutbildning inom IT eller motsvarande kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet och kunskaper inom IAM området, såsom JML, authorization, authentication och loggning/compliance
* Erfarenhet av Entra ID, AD och hybridmiljöer
* God förståelse för gruppolicyer, conditional access och MFA-konfiguration
* Goda kunskaper inom federerad SSO med SAML och OAuth
* Flytande svenska i både tal och skrift och goda kunskaper i engelska
* Bekant med koncept så som JIT, RBAC & Access Review.


 Vi letar efter dig som är strukturerad, noggrann och har en skarp analytisk förmåga. Du tar egna initiativ och har en helhetssyn som gör att du ser hur detaljerna samverkar med de större målen. Du trivs med problemlösning och har en naturlig fallenhet för att bygga och vårda relationer, vilket bidrar till ett framgångsrikt samarbete. För oss är dina personliga egenskaper avgörande – vi uppskattar ditt engagemang, din samarbetsförmåga och din drivkraft att utvecklas. Erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt är meriterande.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen?**
* Implementera, standardisera och underhålla identitetsplattformar i molnet och on-prem
* Samarbeta nära med tvärfunktionella team för att anpassa lösningar utifrån verksamhetens behov
* Felsöka och lösa problem med tjänster och implementera nya lösningar
* Guida och supportera verksamhet och utvecklingsteam i identitetsrelaterade frågor.


 Som IT Identity Engineer kommer du att arbeta med att implementera och underhålla lösningar i både Azure och Onprem miljöer. Du kommer att vara en viktig del av vårt team och bidra till att driva arbetet inom identitet och access framåt. Ving befinner sig i en stor transformationsresa in i molnet och här blir du en central del. I rollen kommer du att arbeta hands-on med att implementera lösningar och supportera utvecklingsteam gällande frågor runt identitet och access.
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå i teamet Technology Services som ansvarar för ett modernt private cloud-datacenter byggt på Microsoft-teknologi och Azure public cloud-lösningar med fokus på SaaS och PaaS lösningar. Teamet strävar efter att ständigt förbättras och du kommer ges stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling.
   

  

 Intresserad? Skicka in ansökan snarast då urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Denna rekryteringsprocess innehåller bakgrundskontroll som sammanställer tidigare offentligt brottsregister och ekonomisk skuldupplysning.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs – ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Testerna utgår från vedertagen forskning och ger oss möjlighet att på ett opartiskt sätt bedöma dina styrkor och eventuella utmaningar i relation till aktuell tjänst. Om du uppfyller grundkraven hos oss kommer du att få testerna skickade till dig och även mer information om dessa, men om du är nyfiken redan nu kan du läsa mer om dem hos Alva Labs.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten kontakta Henrik Eriksson ( henrik.eriksson@nltg.com ).
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
**🏄‍♂️ Kul på jobbet**
**🤝 Tjänstepension**
**🌎 Reseförmåner**
**🦉 Utveckling och lärande**
**💗 Well-being**
**💼 Hybrid arbetsplats**
 Läs mer om vad vi erbjuder här
   

  

 Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernenNordic Leisure Travel Group.
   

  

 I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Ving Norge, Globetrotter, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 500 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.

 IT

title: Technical Account Manager (Sweden)
description:
**Description**
 At Amazon, our vision is to be earth’s most customer-centric company. In 2006, we launched Amazon Web Services, giving customers access to the same cloud technology we built to serve millions of shoppers on Amazon.com. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a secure cloud services platform, offering computing power, database storage, content delivery, and other functionality to help businesses scale and grow. Millions of businesses are using AWS cloud solutions to build sophisticated applications with increased flexibility, scalability and reliability.
   

  

**About AWS**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 An AWS Technical Account Manager is a trusted advisor and cloud operations architect for our Enterprise Support customers. As a trusted advisor you’ll have a direct impact in helping our customers gain the most value from cloud technology. You’ll craft and execute strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of AWS services. This includes a range of products including EC2, S3, DynamoDB & RDS databases, Lambda, CloudFront CDN, IoT and many more.
   

  

 Our Technical Account Managers partner with some of the most iconic businesses in the country. These range from rising startups building their business from scratch through to large enterprises going through significant transformation. You’ll provide advice on architecture, support strategy, project and launch planning as well as ongoing operational issues.
   

  

**See What The Team Say About Their Roles**
 https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-liga-sr-technical-account-manager
   

  

 https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-balint-senior-technical-account-manager
   

  

 https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-shlomo-senior-technical-account-manager
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* You’ll advise on solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer
* Ensure AWS environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity
* Develop trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges
* Using your technical acumen and customer obsession, you’ll drive technical discussions regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management
* Consult with a range of partners from developers through to C-suite executives
* Collaborate with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Developers, Professional Services Consultants, and Sales Account Managers
* With a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from AWS
* Provide detailed reviews of service events, monthly & quarterly metrics, detailed pre-launch planning
* Solve a variety of problems across different customers as they migrate their workloads to the cloud
* Uplift customer capabilities by running workshops, brown bag sessions, etc.


 A day in the life
   

  

 “AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.”
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in a similar role as a Technical Account Manager, Consultant, Solutions Architect, Platform Engineer, Systems Engineer, Cloud Architect etc.
* Understand operational parameters and troubleshooting for a combination of the following: Compute, Storage, Networking, CDN, Databases, DevOps, Big Data and Analytics, Security, Applications Development
* Internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience with the ability to clearly articulate to small and large audiences
* Ability to juggle tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment
* Customer obsessed


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Professional experience with cloud offerings such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform etc.
* Programming or scripting skills with a combination of Java, Python Perl, Ruby, C#, and/or PHP a plus but not a requirement
* Previous experience as a Software Engineer, Developer, DevOps Engineer etc.
* Understanding of DevOps practices and tools including Continuous Integration / Deployment, Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes, Chef is a plus


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers.
